1‚Üí# Issue #36: Device Firmware Slot Rejection - Diagnostic Workplan
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí**Issue**: Launch Control XL3: Device firmware rejects writes to inactive slots (status 0x9)
     4‚Üí**Status**: Investigation Phase
     5‚Üí**Created**: 2025-10-12
     6‚Üí**Branch**: `issues/36-slot-rejection`
     7‚Üí**Severity**: High - Core functionality blocked
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí---
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí## Problem Statement
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí### Summary
    14‚Üí
    15‚ÜíThe Novation Launch Control XL3 device firmware **rejects write operations to slots that are not currently active** on the physical device, returning status code `0x9` (device rejection). This prevents programmatic multi-slot management from working, blocking core functionality in the xl3-web application.
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üí### Impact
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí**Functionality Blocked**:
    20‚Üí- Users cannot copy modes between slots programmatically
    21‚Üí- Multi-slot management from web UI is non-functional
    22‚Üí- Limits device to effectively one user-programmable slot at a time
    23‚Üí- Defeats purpose of 15-slot architecture for remote management
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí**Data Integrity**: Safe - Device rejects invalid operations cleanly (no corruption risk)
    26‚Üí
    27‚Üí### Environment
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí- **Device**: Novation Launch Control XL3 (Serial: LX280935400469)
    30‚Üí- **Firmware**: v1.0.10.84
    31‚Üí- **Library**: @oletizi/launch-control-xl3 v1.20.2
    32‚Üí- **Web App**: xl3-web v0.1.0
    33‚Üí- **Related Issue**: oletizi/xl3-web#4
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí---
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí## Analysis & Evidence
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí### Code Review Findings
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí#### 1. Acknowledgement Handling (DeviceManager.ts)
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí**Location**: `src/device/DeviceManager.ts:70, 441-451`
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí\```typescript
    46‚Üí// Line 70: Acknowledgement tracking
    47‚Üíprivate pendingAcknowledgements = new Map<number, {
    48‚Üí  resolve: () => void;
    49‚Üí  reject: (error: Error) => void;
    50‚Üí  timeout: NodeJS.Timeout;
    51‚Üí}>();
    52‚Üí
    53‚Üí// Line 441-451: Acknowledgement handler
    54‚Üícase 'write_acknowledgement':
    55‚Üí  const ack = parsed as any;
    56‚Üí  const pending = this.pendingAcknowledgements.get(ack.page);
    57‚Üí  if (pending) {
    58‚Üí    clearTimeout(pending.timeout);
    59‚Üí    this.pendingAcknowledgements.delete(ack.page);
    60‚Üí    if (ack.status === 0x06) {
    61‚Üí      pending.resolve();  // Success
    62‚Üí    } else {
    63‚Üí      pending.reject(new Error(`Write failed for page ${ack.page}: status 0x${ack.status.toString(16)}`));
    64‚Üí    }
    65‚Üí  }
    66‚Üí  break;
    67‚Üí\```
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí**Observations**:
    70‚Üí- Handles write acknowledgements correctly
    71‚Üí- Distinguishes between success (0x06) and rejection (0x09)
    72‚Üí- **Missing**: No handling for slot selection acknowledgements
    73‚Üí- Only tracks page-level operations, not slot-level state
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí#### 2. Template Selection Implementation (DeviceManager.ts)
    76‚Üí
    77‚Üí**Location**: `src/device/DeviceManager.ts:520-535`
    78‚Üí
    79‚Üí\```typescript
    80‚Üí/**
    81‚Üí * Select a template slot (0-15)
    82‚Üí */
    83‚Üíasync selectTemplate(slot: number): Promise<void> {
    84‚Üí  if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
    85‚Üí    throw new Error('Template slot must be 0-15');
    86‚Üí  }
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí  // Send template change message
    89‚Üí  const message = SysExParser.buildTemplateChange(slot);
    90‚Üí  await this.sendSysEx(message);
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí  this.currentMode = {
    93‚Üí    type: 'template',
    94‚Üí    slot,
    95‚Üí  };
    96‚Üí
    97‚Üí  this.emit('device:modeChanged', this.currentMode);
    98‚Üí}
    99‚Üí\```
   100‚Üí
   101‚Üí**Observations**:
   102‚Üí- **Template selection command EXISTS** (command 0x77)
   103‚Üí- Format: `F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 [slot] F7`
   104‚Üí- **CRITICAL**: Method exists but is **NEVER called before writes**
   105‚Üí- Only called during device initialization (selectTemplate(0))
   106‚Üí- No acknowledgement wait implemented
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üí#### 3. Write Implementation (DeviceManager.ts)
   109‚Üí
   110‚Üí**Location**: `src/device/DeviceManager.ts:591-606`
   111‚Üí
   112‚Üí\```typescript
   113‚Üí/**
   114‚Üí * Write custom mode to device
   115‚Üí */
   116‚Üíasync writeCustomMode(slot: number, mode: CustomMode): Promise<void> {
   117‚Üí  if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   118‚Üí    throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   119‚Üí  }
   120‚Üí
   121‚Üí  const modeData = {
   122‚Üí    slot,
   123‚Üí    name: mode.name,
   124‚Üí    controls: mode.controls,
   125‚Üí    colors: mode.colors,
   126‚Üí  };
   127‚Üí
   128‚Üí  const validatedModeData = this.validateCustomModeData(modeData);
   129‚Üí  const message = SysExParser.buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot, validatedModeData);
   130‚Üí  await this.sendSysEx(message);
   131‚Üí}
   132‚Üí\```
   133‚Üí
   134‚Üí**Observations**:
   135‚Üí- Goes **directly to write** without slot pre-selection
   136‚Üí- Includes slot parameter in SysEx message (correct per protocol)
   137‚Üí- **Missing**: No call to `selectTemplate(slot)` before write
   138‚Üí- **Missing**: No acknowledgement wait for slot selection
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üí#### 4. SysEx Parser (SysExParser.ts)
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí**Location**: `src/core/SysExParser.ts:520-533, 674-686`
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí\```typescript
   145‚Üí// Template change builder
   146‚Üístatic buildTemplateChange(templateNumber: number): number[] {
   147‚Üí  if (templateNumber < 0 || templateNumber > 15) {
   148‚Üí    throw new Error('Template number must be 0-15');
   149‚Üí  }
   150‚Üí
   151‚Üí  return [
   152‚Üí    0xF0, // SysEx start
   153‚Üí    ...MANUFACTURER_ID,
   154‚Üí    0x11, // Device ID (Launch Control XL)
   155‚Üí    SysExMessageType.TEMPLATE_CHANGE, // 0x77
   156‚Üí    templateNumber,
   157‚Üí    0xF7, // SysEx end
   158‚Üí  ];
   159‚Üí}
   160‚Üí
   161‚Üí// Write request builder
   162‚Üístatic buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot: number, modeData: CustomModeMessage): number[] {
   163‚Üí  // ... validation ...
   164‚Üí
   165‚Üí  return [
   166‚Üí    0xF0,             // SysEx start
   167‚Üí    0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
   168‚Üí    0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
   169‚Üí    0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
   170‚Üí    0x05,             // Sub-command
   171‚Üí    0x00,             // Reserved
   172‚Üí    0x45,             // Write operation
   173‚Üí    slot,             // Slot number (0-14)
   174‚Üí    ...encodedData,   // Encoded custom mode data
   175‚Üí    0xF7              // SysEx end
   176‚Üí  ];
   177‚Üí}
   178‚Üí\```
   179‚Üí
   180‚Üí**Observations**:
   181‚Üí- Both commands correctly implemented
   182‚Üí- Template change uses device ID 0x11, command 0x77
   183‚Üí- Write uses device ID 0x02, command 0x45
   184‚Üí- **No parsing for template change acknowledgements**
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí#### 5. Protocol Documentation (PROTOCOL.md)
   187‚Üí
   188‚Üí**Location**: `docs/PROTOCOL.md:60-89, 487-500`
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí**Current Documentation States**:
   191‚Üí> "Slot Selection (via SysEx slot byte parameter)
   192‚Üí> Simply include the target slot number (0-14) in the SysEx read request"
   193‚Üí
   194‚Üí**Critical Gap**:
   195‚Üí- Documentation assumes slot byte is sufficient
   196‚Üí- **Does NOT mention template selection requirement**
   197‚Üí- No reference to 0x77 command for writes
   198‚Üí- Deprecated DAW port protocol (but template selection different)
   199‚Üí
   200‚Üí### Issue Evidence from xl3-web
   201‚Üí
   202‚Üí**Automated Test Results** (from issue description):
   203‚Üí
   204‚Üí\```javascript
   205‚Üí[LOG] === SEND DIAGNOSTIC ===
   206‚Üí[LOG] 1. activeSlotIndex: 3                              ‚úÖ CORRECT
   207‚Üí[LOG] 2. activeSlotIndex type: number                    ‚úÖ CORRECT
   208‚Üí[LOG] 3. mode.name: Cutoffj                             ‚úÖ CORRECT
   209‚Üí[LOG] 6. converted mode name: Cutoffj                    ‚úÖ CORRECT
   210‚Üí[LOG] 7. converted controls count: 48                    ‚úÖ CORRECT
   211‚Üí
   212‚Üí[ERROR] Send error: Error: Write failed for page 0: status 0x9
   213‚Üí    at DeviceManager.handleSysExMessage
   214‚Üí\```
   215‚Üí
   216‚Üí**Software Stack Verification**:
   217‚Üí- ‚úÖ Web App - Correctly passes slot parameter
   218‚Üí- ‚úÖ Library API - Device.saveCustomMode(slot, mode) receives correct slot
   219‚Üí- ‚úÖ SysEx Builder - buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot, page, data) uses variable slot
   220‚Üí- ‚úÖ Message Transmission - SysEx message sent successfully to device
   221‚Üí- ‚ùå Device Firmware - Rejects write with status 0x9
   222‚Üí
   223‚Üí### Device Behavior Analysis
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí**Observed Pattern**:
   226‚Üí- Writing to **currently active slot**: ‚úÖ Success (status 0x06)
   227‚Üí- Writing to **slot 0**: ‚úÖ Success (default/fallback slot)
   228‚Üí- Writing to **inactive slot**: ‚ùå Rejection (status 0x09)
   229‚Üí
   230‚Üí**Hypothesis**:
   231‚ÜíThe firmware only accepts writes to:
   232‚Üí1. The currently active slot on the physical device, OR
   233‚Üí2. Slot 0 (special default slot)
   234‚Üí
   235‚ÜíThis explains why:
   236‚Üí- BUG-001 (hardcoded slot 0) "worked" initially
   237‚Üí- BUG-001 fix passed verification (only tested slot 0 writes)
   238‚Üí- Cross-slot operations fail (device rejects inactive slot writes)
   239‚Üí
   240‚Üí---
   241‚Üí
   242‚Üí## Root Cause Hypothesis
   243‚Üí
   244‚Üí### Primary Hypothesis: Missing Slot Pre-Selection
   245‚Üí
   246‚Üí**Theory**: The device requires a **2-phase write protocol**:
   247‚Üí
   248‚Üí\```
   249‚ÜíPhase 1: Select Target Slot
   250‚Üí  Command: F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 [slot] F7
   251‚Üí  Purpose: Activate the target slot on device
   252‚Üí
   253‚ÜíPhase 2: Write to Selected Slot
   254‚Üí  Command: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 [page] [slot] [data] F7
   255‚Üí  Purpose: Write mode data to now-active slot
   256‚Üí\```
   257‚Üí
   258‚Üí**Current Implementation**: Only executes Phase 2
   259‚Üí
   260‚Üí**Evidence Supporting This Hypothesis**:
   261‚Üí1. Template selection command exists but unused before writes
   262‚Üí2. Device accepts writes to "active" slot (whatever is currently selected)
   263‚Üí3. Slot 0 works because it's default/always active
   264‚Üí4. Web editor likely sends 0x77 before 0x45 (needs verification)
   265‚Üí
   266‚Üí### Alternative Hypotheses (Lower Confidence)
   267‚Üí
   268‚Üí**Hypothesis B: Timing Issue**
   269‚Üí- Device needs time to process slot parameter
   270‚Üí- Rapid write after slot change causes rejection
   271‚Üí- **Likelihood**: Low - status 0x09 is explicit rejection, not timeout
   272‚Üí
   273‚Üí**Hypothesis C: Firmware Bug**
   274‚Üí- Device firmware incorrectly validates slot parameter
   275‚Üí- SysEx slot byte should work but doesn't
   276‚Üí- **Likelihood**: Low - too many users would report this
   277‚Üí
   278‚Üí**Hypothesis D: Undocumented Protocol Requirement**
   279‚Üí- Additional handshake step required
   280‚Üí- Missing secret command or parameter
   281‚Üí- **Likelihood**: Medium - but template selection is most obvious candidate
   282‚Üí
   283‚Üí---
   284‚Üí
   285‚Üí## Investigation Plan
   286‚Üí
   287‚Üí### Phase 1: MIDI Traffic Capture (Priority: CRITICAL)
   288‚Üí
   289‚Üí**Duration**: 2-3 hours
   290‚Üí**Goal**: Capture how Novation's web editor handles cross-slot writes
   291‚Üí
   292‚Üí**Tools**:
   293‚Üí- CoreMIDI spy tool: `modules/coremidi/midi-snoop`
   294‚Üí- Playwright browser automation for web editor control
   295‚Üí- Existing utility: `utils/test-daw-port-monitor.ts`
   296‚Üí
   297‚Üí**Procedure**:
   298‚Üí
   299‚Üí1. **Setup MIDI Monitoring**:
   300‚Üí   \```bash
   301‚Üí   cd modules/coremidi/midi-snoop
   302‚Üí   make run
   303‚Üí   \```
   304‚Üí   Monitor both:
   305‚Üí   - LCXL3 1 MIDI In/Out (SysEx port)
   306‚Üí   - LCXL3 1 DAW In/Out (control port)
   307‚Üí
   308‚Üí2. **Test Sequence in Web Editor**:
   309‚Üí
   310‚Üí   **Test A: Write to Active Slot** (baseline)
   311‚Üí   - Select slot 1 on device
   312‚Üí   - Modify mode in web editor
   313‚Üí   - Click "Send to Device"
   314‚Üí   - **Capture**: All MIDI messages
   315‚Üí   - **Expected**: Success, no 0x77 command needed
   316‚Üí
   317‚Üí   **Test B: Cross-Slot Write** (primary test)
   318‚Üí   - Select slot 1 on device (physically)
   319‚Üí   - In web editor, load slot 3
   320‚Üí   - Modify mode
   321‚Üí   - Click "Send to Device" (should target slot 3)
   322‚Üí   - **Capture**: All MIDI messages
   323‚Üí   - **Expected**: 0x77 command before 0x45 write
   324‚Üí
   325‚Üí   **Test C: Sequential Slot Writes**
   326‚Üí   - Write to slot 1
   327‚Üí   - Immediately write to slot 2
   328‚Üí   - Immediately write to slot 3
   329‚Üí   - **Capture**: Message timing and sequencing
   330‚Üí
   331‚Üí3. **Analysis Checklist**:
   332‚Üí   - [ ] Identify 0x77 (template change) commands
   333‚Üí   - [ ] Check timing between 0x77 and 0x45
   334‚Üí   - [ ] Identify acknowledgement format for 0x77
   335‚Üí   - [ ] Verify device sends response to 0x77
   336‚Üí   - [ ] Document complete message sequence
   337‚Üí
   338‚Üí**Deliverable**:
   339‚Üí- MIDI capture log showing complete message sequence
   340‚Üí- Timing analysis (ms between commands)
   341‚Üí- Identification of acknowledgement format
   342‚Üí
   343‚Üí**Success Criteria**:
   344‚Üí- Confirm 0x77 sent before cross-slot writes
   345‚Üí- Document acknowledgement format
   346‚Üí- Understand timing requirements
   347‚Üí
   348‚Üí---
   349‚Üí
   350‚Üí### Phase 2: Template Selection Protocol Validation (Priority: HIGH)
   351‚Üí
   352‚Üí**Duration**: 1-2 hours
   353‚Üí**Goal**: Verify template selection command behavior with real device
   354‚Üí
   355‚Üí**Test Utilities** (create if needed):
   356‚Üí\```typescript
   357‚Üí// utils/test-slot-selection.ts
   358‚Üí// Test programmatic slot selection
   359‚Üí
   360‚Üíasync function testSlotSelection() {
   361‚Üí  const device = await connectDevice();
   362‚Üí
   363‚Üí  // Test 1: Select slot 3
   364‚Üí  await device.selectTemplate(3);
   365‚Üí  await sleep(100); // Wait for device
   366‚Üí
   367‚Üí  // Test 2: Write to slot 3 (should succeed)
   368‚Üí  const testMode = createTestMode();
   369‚Üí  await device.writeCustomMode(3, testMode);
   370‚Üí
   371‚Üí  // Test 3: Write to slot 5 WITHOUT selection (should fail)
   372‚Üí  try {
   373‚Üí    await device.writeCustomMode(5, testMode);
   374‚Üí    console.error('UNEXPECTED: Write succeeded without slot selection');
   375‚Üí  } catch (error) {
   376‚Üí    console.log('EXPECTED: Write failed with status 0x9');
   377‚Üí  }
   378‚Üí}
   379‚Üí\```
   380‚Üí
   381‚Üí**Test Sequence**:
   382‚Üí
   383‚Üí1. **Baseline Test**: Write to active slot
   384‚Üí   - Physically select slot 1
   385‚Üí   - Write to slot 1 programmatically
   386‚Üí   - **Expected**: Success (status 0x06)
   387‚Üí
   388‚Üí2. **Slot Selection Test**: Template change then write
   389‚Üí   - Physically on slot 1
   390‚Üí   - Send: `F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 03 F7` (select slot 3)
   391‚Üí   - Wait for device response/acknowledgement
   392‚Üí   - Write to slot 3
   393‚Üí   - **Expected**: Success (status 0x06)
   394‚Üí
   395‚Üí3. **No Selection Test**: Direct write to inactive slot
   396‚Üí   - Physically on slot 1
   397‚Üí   - Write directly to slot 3 (no 0x77 first)
   398‚Üí   - **Expected**: Failure (status 0x09)
   399‚Üí
   400‚Üí4. **Timing Test**: Various delays between selection and write
   401‚Üí   - Try delays: 0ms, 50ms, 100ms, 200ms, 500ms
   402‚Üí   - Identify minimum safe delay
   403‚Üí
   404‚Üí**Deliverable**:
   405‚Üí- Empirical confirmation that 0x77 enables writes
   406‚Üí- Documented acknowledgement format for template changes
   407‚Üí- Minimum timing requirement
   408‚Üí
   409‚Üí**Success Criteria**:
   410‚Üí- Phase 2 test succeeds (0x77 + write = success)
   411‚Üí- Phase 3 test fails (no 0x77 + write = 0x09)
   412‚Üí- Timing requirement identified
   413‚Üí
   414‚Üí---
   415‚Üí
   416‚Üí### Phase 3: Acknowledgement Protocol Analysis (Priority: MEDIUM)
   417‚Üí
   418‚Üí**Duration**: 1 hour
   419‚Üí**Goal**: Understand device response to template selection
   420‚Üí
   421‚Üí**Current Knowledge**:
   422‚Üí- Write acknowledgements: `F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 15 [page] [status] F7`
   423‚Üí- Template changes may have different format
   424‚Üí- Web editor waits ~24-27ms for write ACKs
   425‚Üí
   426‚Üí**Investigation**:
   427‚Üí
   428‚Üí1. **Identify Template Change Response Format**:
   429‚Üí   - Send: `F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 03 F7`
   430‚Üí   - Capture: Device response message
   431‚Üí   - Parse: Identify status/confirmation bytes
   432‚Üí
   433‚Üí2. **Compare with Template Change SysEx** (line 387-394 in DeviceManager.ts):
   434‚Üí   \```typescript
   435‚Üí   case 'template_change':
   436‚Üí     const templateChange = this.validateTemplateChangeResponse(parsed);
   437‚Üí     this.currentMode = { type: 'template', slot: templateChange.templateNumber };
   438‚Üí     this.emit('device:modeChanged', this.currentMode);
   439‚Üí     break;
   440‚Üí   \```
   441‚Üí   - Check if device sends template_change response
   442‚Üí   - May be receiving it but not waiting for it
   443‚Üí
   444‚Üí3. **Timing Analysis**:
   445‚Üí   - Measure response time from 0x77 send to ACK receive
   446‚Üí   - Compare with write ACK timing (24-27ms)
   447‚Üí   - Determine if explicit wait needed or event-based
   448‚Üí
   449‚Üí**Deliverable**:
   450‚Üí- Template change acknowledgement specification
   451‚Üí- Parser implementation for template change ACK
   452‚Üí- Timing requirements documented
   453‚Üí
   454‚Üí**Success Criteria**:
   455‚Üí- Can parse template change responses
   456‚Üí- Know when to proceed with write
   457‚Üí- Have timeout values for error handling
   458‚Üí
   459‚Üí---
   460‚Üí
   461‚Üí## Implementation Plan
   462‚Üí
   463‚Üí### Phase 4: Slot Selection Wrapper Implementation (Priority: HIGH)
   464‚Üí
   465‚Üí**Duration**: 2-3 hours
   466‚Üí**Goal**: Add programmatic slot selection before writes
   467‚Üí
   468‚Üí**Approach**: Modify existing write flow to include slot pre-selection
   469‚Üí
   470‚Üí#### Changes Required
   471‚Üí
   472‚Üí**File**: `src/device/DeviceManager.ts`
   473‚Üí
   474‚Üí**Location**: `writeCustomMode()` method (line 591)
   475‚Üí
   476‚Üí**Implementation**:
   477‚Üí
   478‚Üí\```typescript
   479‚Üí/**
   480‚Üí * Write custom mode to device
   481‚Üí *
   482‚Üí * UPDATED: Now includes slot pre-selection to ensure device accepts write
   483‚Üí */
   484‚Üíasync writeCustomMode(slot: number, mode: CustomMode): Promise<void> {
   485‚Üí  if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   486‚Üí    throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   487‚Üí  }
   488‚Üí
   489‚Üí  // NEW: Phase 1 - Select target slot
   490‚Üí  console.log(`[DeviceManager] Selecting slot ${slot} before write`);
   491‚Üí  await this.selectTemplate(slot);
   492‚Üí
   493‚Üí  // NEW: Phase 1.5 - Wait for device to acknowledge slot selection
   494‚Üí  // (Implementation depends on Phase 3 findings)
   495‚Üí  await this.waitForSlotSelection(slot);
   496‚Üí
   497‚Üí  // EXISTING: Phase 2 - Write to now-active slot
   498‚Üí  const modeData = {
   499‚Üí    slot,
   500‚Üí    name: mode.name,
   501‚Üí    controls: mode.controls,
   502‚Üí    colors: mode.colors,
   503‚Üí  };
   504‚Üí
   505‚Üí  const validatedModeData = this.validateCustomModeData(modeData);
   506‚Üí  const message = SysExParser.buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot, validatedModeData);
   507‚Üí  await this.sendSysEx(message);
   508‚Üí}
   509‚Üí
   510‚Üí/**
   511‚Üí * Wait for device to acknowledge slot selection
   512‚Üí *
   513‚Üí * NEW METHOD: Ensures device has switched slots before write
   514‚Üí */
   515‚Üíprivate async waitForSlotSelection(slot: number): Promise<void> {
   516‚Üí  // Implementation option A: Fixed delay (simple, may be fragile)
   517‚Üí  await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 100)); // 100ms
   518‚Üí
   519‚Üí  // Implementation option B: Wait for acknowledgement (robust, complex)
   520‚Üí  // return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
   521‚Üí  //   const timeout = setTimeout(() => {
   522‚Üí  //     reject(new Error(`Slot selection timeout for slot ${slot}`));
   523‚Üí  //   }, 1000);
   524‚Üí  //
   525‚Üí  //   this.once('device:modeChanged', (mode) => {
   526‚Üí  //     if (mode.slot === slot) {
   527‚Üí  //       clearTimeout(timeout);
   528‚Üí  //       resolve();
   529‚Üí  //     }
   530‚Üí  //   });
   531‚Üí  // });
   532‚Üí}
   533‚Üí\```
   534‚Üí
   535‚Üí**Decision Point**: Fixed Delay vs. Acknowledgement Wait
   536‚Üí
   537‚Üí**Option A: Fixed Delay** (RECOMMENDED for MVP)
   538‚Üí- **Pros**: Simple, requires no protocol changes
   539‚Üí- **Cons**: May be too slow (waste time) or too fast (race condition)
   540‚Üí- **Implementation**: 100ms delay (conservative)
   541‚Üí
   542‚Üí**Option B: Acknowledgement Wait** (IDEAL for production)
   543‚Üí- **Pros**: Robust, optimal timing, error detection
   544‚Üí- **Cons**: Requires Phase 3 completion, more complex
   545‚Üí- **Implementation**: Event-based wait with timeout
   546‚Üí
   547‚Üí**Recommendation**: Start with Option A (fixed delay) for initial testing, refine to Option B if needed.
   548‚Üí
   549‚Üí#### Additional Changes
   550‚Üí
   551‚Üí**File**: `src/device/DeviceManager.ts`
   552‚Üí**Enhancement**: Update template change handler
   553‚Üí
   554‚Üí\```typescript
   555‚Üí// EXISTING (line 387-394)
   556‚Üícase 'template_change':
   557‚Üí  const templateChange = this.validateTemplateChangeResponse(parsed);
   558‚Üí  this.currentMode = {
   559‚Üí    type: 'template',
   560‚Üí    slot: templateChange.templateNumber,
   561‚Üí  };
   562‚Üí  this.emit('device:modeChanged', this.currentMode);
   563‚Üí  break;
   564‚Üí
   565‚Üí// ENHANCED: Add to setupMidiHandlers() to receive during initialization
   566‚Üíthis.midi.on('sysex', (message: MidiMessage) => {
   567‚Üí  // Remove isInitializing check for template_change messages
   568‚Üí  this.emit('sysex:received', message.data);
   569‚Üí  this.handleSysExMessage([...message.data]);
   570‚Üí});
   571‚Üí\```
   572‚Üí
   573‚Üí**Rationale**: Template change responses should be handled even during writes, not just initialization.
   574‚Üí
   575‚Üí### Testing During Implementation

   816‚Üí**Goal**: Update all documentation to reflect slot selection requirement
   817‚Üí
   818‚Üí### Files to Update
   819‚Üí
   820‚Üí#### 1. PROTOCOL.md
   821‚Üí
   822‚Üí**Location**: `modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/docs/PROTOCOL.md`
   823‚Üí
   824‚Üí**Changes Required**:
   825‚Üí
   826‚Üí**Section to Add** (after line 188):
   827‚Üí
   828‚Üí\```markdown
   829‚Üí### Slot Selection for Writes
   830‚Üí
   831‚Üí**CRITICAL REQUIREMENT**: Before writing to any slot, the device MUST be instructed to select that slot via template change command.
   832‚Üí
   833‚Üí**Protocol Sequence**:
   834‚Üí\```
   835‚ÜíStep 1: Select Target Slot
   836‚Üí  Message: F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 [slot] F7
   837‚Üí  Command: 0x77 (Template Change)
   838‚Üí  Purpose: Activate target slot on device
   839‚Üí
   840‚ÜíStep 2: Wait for Device Response
   841‚Üí  Expected: Template change acknowledgement (format TBD)
   842‚Üí  Timing: ~24-50ms response time
   843‚Üí
   844‚ÜíStep 3: Write to Selected Slot
   845‚Üí  Message: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 [page] [slot] [data] F7
   846‚Üí  Command: 0x45 (Write)
   847‚Üí  Purpose: Write mode data to now-active slot
   848‚Üí\```
   849‚Üí
   850‚Üí**Why This is Required**:
   851‚Üí- Device firmware only accepts writes to the currently active slot
   852‚Üí- The slot parameter in the write message (0x45) is **not sufficient** alone
   853‚Üí- Template change (0x77) activates the slot and enables write operations
   854‚Üí
   855‚Üí**Example: Writing to Slot 3**:
   856‚Üí\```
   857‚Üí1. Send: F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 03 F7  (select slot 3)
   858‚Üí2. Wait: ~100ms for device to switch
   859‚Üí3. Send: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 00 03 [data] F7  (write page 0 to slot 3)
   860‚Üí4. Wait: For acknowledgement (F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 15 00 06 F7)
   861‚Üí5. Send: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 03 03 [data] F7  (write page 1 to slot 3)
   862‚Üí6. Wait: For acknowledgement
   863‚Üí\```
   864‚Üí
   865‚Üí**Error Handling**:
   866‚Üí- Writing without slot selection: Device returns status 0x09 (rejection)
   867‚Üí- Writing to slot 0: May work without selection (default/fallback slot)
   868‚Üí- Writing to slot 15: Reserved, immutable - always fails
   869‚Üí\```
   870‚Üí
   871‚Üí**Version History Entry**:
   872‚Üí\```markdown
   873‚Üí| 1.9 | 2025-10-12 | **Slot Selection Discovery:** Documented requirement for template change (0x77) before writes. Device rejects writes to inactive slots with status 0x09. Added complete write protocol sequence. Reference: GitHub issue #36 |
   874‚Üí\```
   875‚Üí
   876‚Üí---
   877‚Üí
   878‚Üí#### 2. ARCHITECTURE.md
   879‚Üí
   880‚Üí**Location**: `modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/docs/ARCHITECTURE.md`
   881‚Üí
   882‚Üí**Section to Update**: "Write Flow" diagram
   883‚Üí
   884‚Üí**Add**:
   885‚Üí\```markdown
   886‚Üí### Custom Mode Write Flow (Updated 2025-10-12)
   887‚Üí
   888‚Üí\```
   889‚Üí‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
   890‚Üí‚îÇ  Application    ‚îÇ
   891‚Üí‚îÇ  Request Write  ‚îÇ
   892‚Üí‚îÇ  to Slot N      ‚îÇ
   893‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
   894‚Üí         ‚îÇ
   895‚Üí         ‚Üì
   896‚Üí‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
   897‚Üí‚îÇ DeviceManager       ‚îÇ
   898‚Üí‚îÇ .writeCustomMode(N) ‚îÇ
   899‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
   900‚Üí         ‚îÇ
   901‚Üí         ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Phase 1: Slot Selection
   902‚Üí         ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí buildTemplateChange(N)
   903‚Üí         ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Send 0x77 command
   904‚Üí         ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚Üí Wait for ACK/confirmation
   905‚Üí         ‚îÇ
   906‚Üí         ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Phase 2: Write Page 0
   907‚Üí         ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí buildCustomModeWriteRequest(N, page=0)
   908‚Üí         ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Send 0x45 command (page 0)
   909‚Üí         ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚Üí Wait for ACK (status 0x06)
   910‚Üí         ‚îÇ
   911‚Üí         ‚îî‚îÄ‚Üí Phase 3: Write Page 1
   912‚Üí             ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí buildCustomModeWriteRequest(N, page=1)
   913‚Üí             ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Send 0x45 command (page 1)
   914‚Üí             ‚îî‚îÄ‚Üí Wait for ACK (status 0x06)
   915‚Üí\```
   916‚Üí
   917‚Üí**Key Changes (Issue #36 Fix)**:
   918‚Üí- Added Phase 1: Slot Selection via template change (0x77)
   919‚Üí- Device must acknowledge slot switch before write
   920‚Üí- Prevents status 0x09 rejection on inactive slots
   921‚Üí\```
   922‚Üí
   923‚Üí---
   924‚Üí
   925‚Üí#### 3. API.md
   926‚Üí
   927‚Üí**Location**: `modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/docs/API.md`
   928‚Üí
   929‚Üí**Update**: `writeCustomMode()` documentation
   930‚Üí
   931‚Üí\```markdown
   932‚Üí### writeCustomMode(slot, mode)
   933‚Üí
   934‚ÜíWrite a custom mode to the device.
   935‚Üí
   936‚Üí**IMPORTANT (v1.21.0+)**: This method now includes automatic slot selection. The device will physically switch to the target slot before writing. This may cause a brief visual indication on the device.
   937‚Üí
   938‚Üí**Parameters**:
   939‚Üí- `slot` (number): Target slot (0-14, slot 15 is reserved)
   940‚Üí- `mode` (CustomMode): Mode configuration to write
   941‚Üí
   942‚Üí**Behavior**:
   943‚Üí1. Sends template change command to select target slot
   944‚Üí2. Waits for device to acknowledge slot selection
   945‚Üí3. Writes mode data to now-active slot
   946‚Üí4. Returns after both pages written successfully
   947‚Üí
   948‚Üí**Timing**: Approximately 0.5-2.0 seconds depending on mode complexity
   949‚Üí
   950‚Üí**Throws**:
   951‚Üí- `Error`: If slot out of range (0-15)
   952‚Üí- `Error`: If slot selection times out
   953‚Üí- `Error`: If write fails (status !== 0x06)
   954‚Üí
   955‚Üí**Example**:
   956‚Üí\```typescript
   957‚Üí// Write to slot 3 (device will switch to slot 3)
   958‚Üíawait device.writeCustomMode(3, myCustomMode);
   959‚Üí
   960‚Üí// Device is now on slot 3 after write completes
   961‚Üí\```
   962‚Üí
   963‚Üí**Historical Note**: Prior to v1.21.0, writes to inactive slots would fail with status 0x09. See GitHub issue #36.
   964‚Üí\```
   965‚Üí
   966‚Üí---
   967‚Üí
   968‚Üí#### 4. CHANGELOG.md
   969‚Üí
   970‚Üí**Location**: `modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/CHANGELOG.md`
   971‚Üí
   972‚Üí**Add Entry**:
   973‚Üí
   974‚Üí\```markdown
   975‚Üí## [1.21.0] - 2025-10-12
   976‚Üí
   977‚Üí### Fixed
   978‚Üí- **Issue #36**: Device now accepts writes to inactive slots by implementing automatic slot selection
   979‚Üí  - Added template change (0x77) before write operations
   980‚Üí  - Device switches to target slot before writing
   981‚Üí  - Eliminates status 0x09 rejection errors
   982‚Üí  - Enables cross-slot operations in xl3-web application
   983‚Üí
   984‚Üí### Changed
   985‚Üí- `DeviceManager.writeCustomMode()` now includes slot pre-selection
   986‚Üí- Write operations may take slightly longer due to slot switching
   987‚Üí- Device physically changes slots during programmatic writes (visible on hardware)
   988‚Üí
   989‚Üí### Documentation
   990‚Üí- Updated PROTOCOL.md with slot selection requirement
   991‚Üí- Updated ARCHITECTURE.md with new write flow diagram
   992‚Üí- Enhanced API.md with timing and behavior notes
   993‚Üí\```
   994‚Üí
   995‚Üí---
   996‚Üí
   997‚Üí#### 5. Module README
   998‚Üí
   999‚Üí**Location**: `modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/README.md`
  1000‚Üí
  1001‚Üí**Add Note** (in "Known Limitations" or similar section):
  1002‚Üí
  1003‚Üí\```markdown
  1004‚Üí### Slot Selection Behavior
  1005‚Üí
  1006‚ÜíWhen writing to a slot programmatically, the device will **physically switch** to that slot. This is required by the device firmware and cannot be avoided.
  1007‚Üí
  1008‚Üí**User Experience Note**: If writing to multiple slots in sequence, users will see the device's slot indicator change. This is normal behavior.
  1009‚Üí
  1010‚Üí**Workaround**: If you need to write to multiple slots without visual switching, there is currently no way to do this with the device firmware. Each write requires slot activation.
  1011‚Üí\```
  1012‚Üí
  1013‚Üí---

  1052‚Üí
  1053‚Üí## Risk Assessment
  1054‚Üí
  1055‚Üí### Technical Risks
  1056‚Üí
  1057‚Üí#### Low Risk ‚úÖ
  1058‚Üí
  1059‚Üí**Risk**: Implementation breaks existing functionality
  1060‚Üí**Mitigation**:
  1061‚Üí- Comprehensive test suite covers baseline scenarios
  1062‚Üí- Changes are additive (slot selection before write)
  1063‚Üí- No modification to existing protocol messages
  1064‚Üí
  1065‚Üí**Risk**: Performance degradation
  1066‚Üí**Mitigation**:
  1067‚Üí- Slot selection adds ~100-300ms (acceptable)
  1068‚Üí- Total write time still < 3 seconds
  1069‚Üí- Performance tests validate timing
  1070‚Üí
  1071‚Üí---
  1072‚Üí
  1073‚Üí#### Medium Risk ‚ö†Ô∏è
  1074‚Üí
  1075‚Üí**Risk**: Timing/synchronization issues between selection and write
  1076‚Üí**Impact**: Intermittent failures, race conditions
  1077‚Üí**Mitigation**:
  1078‚Üí- Start with conservative fixed delay (100ms)
  1079‚Üí- Add explicit acknowledgement wait if needed
  1080‚Üí- Implement timeout error handling
  1081‚Üí
  1082‚Üí**Risk**: Unknown acknowledgement format for template changes
  1083‚Üí**Impact**: Cannot reliably wait for slot selection
  1084‚Üí**Mitigation**:
  1085‚Üí- Phase 3 investigation identifies format
  1086‚Üí- Fallback to fixed delay if no ACK
  1087‚Üí- Use existing event system for template_change
  1088‚Üí
  1089‚Üí**Risk**: Device state management complexity
  1090‚Üí**Impact**: Difficult to track current slot, synchronization issues
  1091‚Üí**Mitigation**:
  1092‚Üí- Use existing currentMode state tracking
  1093‚Üí- Listen to template_change events
  1094‚Üí- Add explicit state queries if needed
  1095‚Üí
  1096‚Üí---
  1097‚Üí
  1098‚Üí#### High Risk üö®
  1099‚Üí
  1100‚Üí**Risk**: Hypothesis is incorrect - slot selection doesn't solve the problem
  1101‚Üí**Impact**: Wasted investigation time, need alternative solution
  1102‚Üí**Mitigation**:
  1103‚Üí- Phase 1 MIDI capture validates hypothesis early
  1104‚Üí- Phase 2 empirical test confirms before full implementation
  1105‚Üí- Alternative hypotheses documented (see below)
  1106‚Üí
  1107‚Üí---
  1108‚Üí
  1109‚Üí### Alternative Approaches
  1110‚Üí
  1111‚ÜíIf slot selection doesn't solve the problem:
  1112‚Üí
  1113‚Üí**Plan B: Require Manual Slot Selection**
  1114‚Üí- Document that user must select slot on device before write
  1115‚Üí- Add UI warning/instruction in xl3-web
  1116‚Üí- **Pros**: Simple, no code changes
  1117‚Üí- **Cons**: Poor UX, defeats purpose of remote management
  1118‚Üí
  1119‚Üí**Plan C: Contact Novation Support**
  1120‚Üí- Request official protocol documentation
  1121‚Üí- Report potential firmware issue
  1122‚Üí- Request firmware update to accept inactive slot writes
  1123‚Üí- **Pros**: Authoritative answer, potential permanent fix
  1124‚Üí- **Cons**: Long timeline, uncertain outcome
  1125‚Üí
  1126‚Üí**Plan D: Read-Modify-Active-Slot Pattern**
  1127‚Üí- Read from target slot ‚Üí memory
  1128‚Üí- User selects slot on device
  1129‚Üí- Write from memory to now-active slot
  1130‚Üí- **Pros**: Works within constraints
  1131‚Üí- **Cons**: Multi-step UX, error-prone
  1132‚Üí
  1133‚Üí**Plan E: Defer to Future Firmware**
  1134‚Üí- Document limitation clearly
  1135‚Üí- Mark as "known issue"
  1136‚Üí- Wait for Novation to address in firmware update
  1137‚Üí- **Pros**: No immediate work required
  1138‚Üí- **Cons**: Indefinite timeline, functionality blocked
  1139‚Üí
  1140‚Üí---

  1171‚Üí
  1172‚Üí## Open Questions
  1173‚Üí
  1174‚Üí### Questions Requiring Investigation
  1175‚Üí
  1176‚Üí1. **What is the exact acknowledgement format for template change (0x77)?**
  1177‚Üí   - Answered by: Phase 3
  1178‚Üí   - Impact: Determines if we can use acknowledgement wait vs fixed delay
  1179‚Üí
  1180‚Üí2. **What is the minimum safe delay between slot selection and write?**
  1181‚Üí   - Answered by: Phase 2 timing tests
  1182‚Üí   - Impact: Determines write operation latency
  1183‚Üí
  1184‚Üí3. **Does the device send any response to template change command?**
  1185‚Üí   - Answered by: Phase 1 MIDI capture
  1186‚Üí   - Impact: Determines acknowledgement wait feasibility
  1187‚Üí
  1188‚Üí4. **Are there any side effects of programmatic slot switching?**
  1189‚Üí   - Answered by: Phase 2 real device testing
  1190‚Üí   - Impact: Determines user experience considerations
  1191‚Üí
  1192‚Üí### Questions for Product/UX
  1193‚Üí
  1194‚Üí1. **Is visible slot switching on device acceptable to users?**
  1195‚Üí   - Cannot be avoided with current firmware
  1196‚Üí   - Alternative: require manual slot selection (poor UX)
  1197‚Üí
  1198‚Üí2. **Should we add progress indication for slot switching in xl3-web?**
  1199‚Üí   - Write now takes 2-3 seconds instead of 1-2 seconds
  1200‚Üí   - Users may wonder why operation is slower
  1201‚Üí
  1202‚Üí3. **Should we batch multiple slot writes to minimize switching?**
  1203‚Üí   - Example: Queue all writes, group by slot, minimize switches
  1204‚Üí   - Trade-off: Complexity vs. performance
  1205‚Üí
  1206‚Üí---

   586‚Üí   * Send CC message to device
   587‚Üí   */
   588‚Üí  async sendCC(controller: number, value: number, channel: number = 0): Promise<void> {
   589‚Üí    if (!this.outputPortId) {
   590‚Üí      throw new Error('Device not connected');
   591‚Üí    }
   592‚Üí
   593‚Üí    // Build CC message: status byte (0xB0 + channel), controller, value
   594‚Üí    const data = [0xB0 | (channel & 0x0F), controller, value];
   595‚Üí    await this.midi.sendMessage(data);
   596‚Üí  }
   597‚Üí
   598‚Üí  /**
   599‚Üí   * Select a template slot (0-15)
   600‚Üí   */
   601‚Üí  async selectTemplate(slot: number): Promise<void> {
   602‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   603‚Üí      throw new Error('Template slot must be 0-15');
   604‚Üí    }
   605‚Üí
   606‚Üí    // Send template change message

   608‚Üí    await this.sendSysEx(message);
   609‚Üí

   611‚Üí      type: 'template',
   612‚Üí      slot,
   613‚Üí    };
   614‚Üí
   615‚Üí    this.emit('device:modeChanged', this.currentMode);
   616‚Üí  }

   620‚Üí   */
   621‚Üí  async readCustomMode(slot: number): Promise<CustomMode> {

   623‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-14 (slot 15 is reserved for immutable factory content)');
   624‚Üí    }

   197‚Üí
   198‚Üí    // For LCXL3, we need:
   199‚Üí    // - Input: "LCXL3 1 MIDI Out" (for receiving control changes from device)
   200‚Üí    // - Output: "LCXL3 1 MIDI In" (for sending SysEx/LED control to device)
   201‚Üí
   202‚Üí    // First try to find the specific ports we need
   203‚Üí    let inputPort = inputPorts.find(port =>
   204‚Üí      port.name === 'LCXL3 1 MIDI Out'
   205‚Üí    );
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí    let outputPort = outputPorts.find(port =>
   208‚Üí      port.name === 'LCXL3 1 MIDI In'
   209‚Üí    );
   210‚Üí
   211‚Üí    // Fall back to filter-based search if specific ports not found
   212‚Üí    if (!inputPort) {
   213‚Üí      inputPort = inputPorts.find(port =>
   214‚Üí        port.name.includes(this.options.deviceNameFilter)

```typescript
/**
 * Device Manager for Novation Launch Control XL 3
 *
 * Handles device discovery, connection, initialization, and communication
 * with the Launch Control XL 3 hardware via MIDI and SysEx.
 */

import { EventEmitter } from 'eventemitter3';
import {
  MidiInterface,
  MidiPortInfo,
  MidiMessage,
  MidiBackendInterface
} from '../core/MidiInterface.js';
import { SysExParser } from '../core/SysExParser.js';
import {
  LaunchControlXL3Info,
  DeviceMode,
  DeviceConnectionState,
  CustomMode,
  DeviceInquiryResponse
} from '../types/index.js';
import { z } from 'zod';

export interface DeviceManagerOptions {
  midiBackend?: MidiBackendInterface | undefined;
  autoConnect?: boolean;
  deviceNameFilter?: string;
  inquiryTimeout?: number;
  retryAttempts?: number;
  retryDelay?: number;
}

export interface DeviceStatus {
  connected: boolean;
  state: DeviceConnectionState;
  deviceInfo?: LaunchControlXL3Info | undefined;
  currentMode?: DeviceMode | undefined;
  lastSeen?: Date;
  error?: string;
}

export interface DeviceEvents {
  'device:connected': (device: LaunchControlXL3Info) => void;
  'device:disconnected': (reason?: string) => void;
  'device:ready': (device: LaunchControlXL3Info) => void;
  'device:error': (error: Error) => void;
  'device:modeChanged': (mode: DeviceMode) => void;
  'control:change': (control: string, value: number, channel?: number) => void;
  'sysex:received': (message: number[]) => void;
}

/**
 * Main device manager for Launch Control XL 3
 */
export class DeviceManager extends EventEmitter {
  private midi: MidiInterface;
  private options: Required<Omit<DeviceManagerOptions, 'midiBackend'>> & { midiBackend?: MidiBackendInterface | undefined };
  private deviceInfo?: LaunchControlXL3Info | undefined;
  private connectionState: DeviceConnectionState = 'disconnected';
  private inputPortId?: string | undefined;
  private outputPortId?: string | undefined;
  private currentMode?: DeviceMode | undefined;
  private inquiryTimer?: NodeJS.Timeout | undefined;
  private reconnectTimer?: NodeJS.Timeout | undefined;
  private isInitializing = false;

  constructor(options: DeviceManagerOptions = {}) {
    super();

    this.options = {
      midiBackend: options.midiBackend,
      autoConnect: options.autoConnect ?? true,
      deviceNameFilter: options.deviceNameFilter ?? 'Launch Control XL',
      inquiryTimeout: options.inquiryTimeout ?? 5000,
      retryAttempts: options.retryAttempts ?? 3,
      retryDelay: options.retryDelay ?? 1000,
    };

    this.midi = new MidiInterface(this.options.midiBackend);
    this.setupMidiHandlers();
  }

  /**
   * Initialize the device manager and optionally connect to device
   */
  async initialize(): Promise<void> {
    try {
      await this.midi.initialize();

      if (this.options.autoConnect) {
        await this.connect();
      }
    } catch (error) {
      this.handleError(error as Error);
      throw error;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Connect to Launch Control XL 3 device
   */
  async connect(): Promise<void> {
    if (this.connectionState === 'connected' || this.connectionState === 'connecting') {
      return;
    }

    this.setConnectionState('connecting');
    this.isInitializing = true;

    try {
      // Find device ports
      const { inputPort, outputPort } = await this.findDevicePorts();

      if (!inputPort || !outputPort) {
        throw new Error('Launch Control XL 3 not found');
      }

      // Open ports
      await this.midi.openInput(inputPort.id);
      await this.midi.openOutput(outputPort.id);

      this.inputPortId = inputPort.id;
      this.outputPortId = outputPort.id;

      // Query device identity using complete 4-message handshake (NO FALLBACK)
      const deviceInfo = await this.queryDeviceIdentity();
      if (deviceInfo) {
        this.deviceInfo = this.parseDeviceInfo(deviceInfo);
      } else {
        throw new Error('Device inquiry returned null response. Device may not be compatible or may be in an invalid state.');
      }

      // Initialize device settings
      await this.initializeDevice();

      this.setConnectionState('connected');
      this.emit('device:connected', this.deviceInfo);
      this.emit('device:ready', this.deviceInfo);

    } catch (error) {
      this.setConnectionState('error');
      await this.disconnect();
      throw error;
    } finally {
      this.isInitializing = false;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Disconnect from device
   */
  async disconnect(reason?: string): Promise<void> {
    this.clearTimers();

    if (this.inputPortId) {
      await this.midi.closeInput();
      this.inputPortId = undefined;
    }

    if (this.outputPortId) {
      await this.midi.closeOutput();
      this.outputPortId = undefined;
    }

    if (this.connectionState !== 'disconnected') {
      this.setConnectionState('disconnected');
      this.emit('device:disconnected', reason);
    }

    this.deviceInfo = undefined;
    this.currentMode = undefined;
  }

  /**
   * Find Launch Control XL 3 ports
   */
  private async findDevicePorts(): Promise<{
    inputPort?: MidiPortInfo | undefined;
    outputPort?: MidiPortInfo | undefined;
  }> {
    const inputPorts = await this.midi.getInputPorts();
    const outputPorts = await this.midi.getOutputPorts();

    // For LCXL3, we need:
    // - Input: "LCXL3 1 MIDI Out" (for receiving control changes from device)
    // - Output: "LCXL3 1 MIDI In" (for sending SysEx/LED control to device)

    // First try to find the specific ports we need
    let inputPort = inputPorts.find(port =>
      port.name === 'LCXL3 1 MIDI Out'
    );

    let outputPort = outputPorts.find(port =>
      port.name === 'LCXL3 1 MIDI In'
    );

    // Fall back to filter-based search if specific ports not found
    if (!inputPort) {
      inputPort = inputPorts.find(port =>
        port.name.includes(this.options.deviceNameFilter)
      );
    }

    if (!outputPort) {
      outputPort = outputPorts.find(port =>
        port.name.includes(this.options.deviceNameFilter)
      );
    }

    console.log('[DeviceManager] Found ports:', {
      input: inputPort?.name,
      output: outputPort?.name
    });

    return { inputPort, outputPort };
  }

  /**
   * Query device identity using the complete 4-message handshake protocol
   */
  private async queryDeviceIdentity(): Promise<DeviceInquiryResponse | null> {
    let serialNumber: string | undefined;

    // Step 1: Send Novation SYN
    console.log('[DeviceManager] Handshake Step 1: Sending Novation SYN...');
    const synMessage = SysExParser.buildNovationSyn();
    await this.sendSysEx(synMessage);

    // Step 2: Wait for SYN-ACK response
    try {
      const synAckData = await this.waitForMessage(
        (data) => {
          const result = SysExParser.parseNovationSynAck(data);
          return result.valid;
        },
        this.options.inquiryTimeout,
        'SYN-ACK'
      );

      const synAckResult = SysExParser.parseNovationSynAck(synAckData);
      serialNumber = synAckResult.serialNumber;
      console.log('[DeviceManager] Handshake Step 2: Received SYN-ACK with serial:', serialNumber);
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(
        `Handshake failed at SYN-ACK step: ${(error as Error).message}. ` +
        'Device may not support complete handshake protocol.'
      );
    }

    // Step 3: Send Universal Device Inquiry (ACK) with correct device ID
    console.log('[DeviceManager] Handshake Step 3: Sending Universal Device Inquiry (ACK)...');
    const ackMessage = SysExParser.buildUniversalDeviceInquiry();
    await this.sendSysEx(ackMessage);

    // Step 4: Wait for Device Response
    try {
      const deviceResponseData = await this.waitForMessage(
        (data) => SysExParser.isDeviceInquiryResponse(data),
        this.options.inquiryTimeout,
        'Device Response'
      );

      console.log('[DeviceManager] Handshake Step 4: Received device response');
      const parsed = SysExParser.parse(deviceResponseData);

      if (parsed.type === 'device_inquiry_response') {
        // Cast parsed to DeviceInquiryResponse from SysExParser
        const parsedResponse = parsed as any; // Type from SysExParser

        // Create response object for validation with type field
        const response = {
          type: 'device_inquiry_response' as const,
          manufacturerId: parsedResponse.manufacturerId || [],
          deviceFamily: parsedResponse.familyCode || 0,
          deviceModel: parsedResponse.familyMember || 0,
          firmwareVersion: parsedResponse.softwareRevision || [],
          ...(serialNumber ? { serialNumber: serialNumber.split('').map(c => c.charCodeAt(0)) } : {}),
          // Include optional properties if present
          ...(parsedResponse.familyCode !== undefined ? { familyCode: parsedResponse.familyCode } : {}),
          ...(parsedResponse.familyMember !== undefined ? { familyMember: parsedResponse.familyMember } : {}),
          ...(parsedResponse.softwareRevision !== undefined ? { softwareRevision: parsedResponse.softwareRevision } : {}),
        };
        const validatedResponse = this.validateDeviceInquiryResponse(response);
        return validatedResponse;
      }

      throw new Error('Invalid device response type');
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(
        `Handshake failed at device response step: ${(error as Error).message}. ` +
        'Troubleshooting steps: 1) Verify device is powered and connected, ' +
        '2) Check MIDI cable/USB connection, 3) Ensure device firmware is up to date.'
      );
    }
  }

  /**
   * Wait for a specific MIDI message with timeout
   */
  private async waitForMessage(
    validator: (data: number[]) => boolean,
    timeoutMs: number,
    messageName: string
  ): Promise<number[]> {
    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
      const timeout = setTimeout(() => {
        this.midi.removeListener('sysex', handleResponse);
        reject(new Error(`Handshake timeout waiting for ${messageName} after ${timeoutMs}ms`));
      }, timeoutMs);

      const handleResponse = (message: MidiMessage) => {
        if (message.type === 'sysex' && validator([...message.data])) {
          clearTimeout(timeout);
          this.midi.removeListener('sysex', handleResponse);
          resolve([...message.data]);
        }
      };

      this.midi.on('sysex', handleResponse);
    });
  }

  /**
   * Parse device info from inquiry response
   */
  private parseDeviceInfo(response: DeviceInquiryResponse): LaunchControlXL3Info {
    const validatedInfo = this.validateDeviceInfo({
      manufacturerId: response.manufacturerId.map(b =>
        b.toString(16).padStart(2, '0')
      ).join(' '),
      deviceFamily: response.familyCode ?? response.deviceFamily ?? 0,
      modelNumber: response.familyMember ?? response.deviceModel ?? 0,
      firmwareVersion: response.softwareRevision ?
        `${response.softwareRevision[0]}.${response.softwareRevision[1]}.${response.softwareRevision[2]}.${response.softwareRevision[3]}` :
        (response.firmwareVersion ? Array.from(response.firmwareVersion).join('.') : 'unknown'),
      serialNumber: typeof response.serialNumber === 'string' ?
        response.serialNumber :
        (response.serialNumber ? Array.from(response.serialNumber).join('') : undefined),
    });

    return validatedInfo;
  }

  /**
   * Initialize device after connection
   */
  private async initializeDevice(): Promise<void> {
    // Additional initialization steps can be added here
    // For example: loading custom modes, setting initial LED states, etc.

    // Set initial mode to User mode
    await this.selectTemplate(0);
  }

  /**
   * Setup MIDI event handlers
   */
  private setupMidiHandlers(): void {
    this.midi.on('controlchange', (message: MidiMessage) => {
      if (!this.isInitializing && this.connectionState === 'connected') {
        const control = this.getControlName(message.controller!, message.channel!);
        this.emit('control:change', control, message.value!, message.channel);
      }
    });

    this.midi.on('sysex', (message: MidiMessage) => {
      if (!this.isInitializing && this.connectionState === 'connected') {
        this.emit('sysex:received', message.data);
        this.handleSysExMessage([...message.data]);
      }
    });

    this.midi.on('error', (error: Error) => {
      this.handleError(error);
    });
  }

  /**
   * Handle incoming SysEx messages
   */
  private handleSysExMessage(data: number[]): void {
    try {
      const parsed = SysExParser.parse(data);

      switch (parsed.type) {
        case 'template_change':
          const templateChange = this.validateTemplateChangeResponse(parsed);
          this.currentMode = {
            type: 'template',
            slot: templateChange.templateNumber,
          };
          this.emit('device:modeChanged', this.currentMode);
          break;

        // Add more SysEx message handlers as needed
      }
    } catch {
      // Ignore unrecognized SysEx messages
    }
  }

  /**
   * Get human-readable control name
   */
  private getControlName(controller: number, _channel: number): string {
    // Map CC numbers to control names based on Launch Control XL 3 layout
    const controlMap: Record<number, string> = {
      // Send A knobs
      13: 'sendA1', 14: 'sendA2', 15: 'sendA3', 16: 'sendA4',
      17: 'sendA5', 18: 'sendA6', 19: 'sendA7', 20: 'sendA8',

      // Send B knobs
      29: 'sendB1', 30: 'sendB2', 31: 'sendB3', 32: 'sendB4',
      33: 'sendB5', 34: 'sendB6', 35: 'sendB7', 36: 'sendB8',

      // Pan/Device knobs
      49: 'pan1', 50: 'pan2', 51: 'pan3', 52: 'pan4',
      53: 'pan5', 54: 'pan6', 55: 'pan7', 56: 'pan8',

      // Faders
      77: 'fader1', 78: 'fader2', 79: 'fader3', 80: 'fader4',
      81: 'fader5', 82: 'fader6', 83: 'fader7', 84: 'fader8',
    };

    return controlMap[controller] || `cc${controller}`;
  }

  /**
   * Set connection state
   */
  private setConnectionState(state: DeviceConnectionState): void {
    this.connectionState = state;
  }

  /**
   * Handle errors
   */
  private handleError(error: Error): void {
    console.error('[DeviceManager] Error:', error.message);
    this.emit('device:error', error);

    if (this.connectionState === 'connected') {
      this.attemptReconnect();
    }
  }

  /**
   * Attempt to reconnect after connection loss
   */
  private attemptReconnect(): void {
    if (this.reconnectTimer) {
      return;
    }

    let attempts = 0;

    const tryReconnect = async () => {
      if (attempts >= this.options.retryAttempts) {
        this.clearTimers();
        await this.disconnect('Max reconnection attempts reached');
        return;
      }

      attempts++;

      try {
        await this.connect();
        this.clearTimers();
      } catch {
        this.reconnectTimer = setTimeout(tryReconnect, this.options.retryDelay);
      }
    };

    this.reconnectTimer = setTimeout(tryReconnect, this.options.retryDelay);
  }

  /**
   * Clear all timers
   */
  private clearTimers(): void {
    if (this.inquiryTimer) {
      clearTimeout(this.inquiryTimer as NodeJS.Timeout);
      this.inquiryTimer = undefined;
    }

    if (this.reconnectTimer) {
      clearTimeout(this.reconnectTimer as NodeJS.Timeout);
      this.reconnectTimer = undefined;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Send SysEx message to device
   */
  async sendSysEx(data: number[]): Promise<void> {
    if (!this.outputPortId) {
      throw new Error('Device not connected');
    }

    await this.midi.sendMessage(data);
  }

  /**
   * Send CC message to device
   */
  async sendCC(controller: number, value: number, channel: number = 0): Promise<void> {
    if (!this.outputPortId) {
      throw new Error('Device not connected');
    }

    // Build CC message: status byte (0xB0 + channel), controller, value
    const data = [0xB0 | (channel & 0x0F), controller, value];
    await this.midi.sendMessage(data);
  }

  /**
   * Select a template slot (0-15)
   */
  async selectTemplate(slot: number): Promise<void> {
    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
      throw new Error('Template slot must be 0-15');
    }

    // Send template change message
    const message = SysExParser.buildTemplateChange(slot);
    await this.sendSysEx(message);

    this.currentMode = {
      type: 'template',
      slot,
    };

    this.emit('device:modeChanged', this.currentMode);
  }

  /**
   * Read custom mode from device
   */
  async readCustomMode(slot: number): Promise<CustomMode> {
    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
    }

    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
      const timeout = setTimeout(() => {
        this.midi.removeListener('sysex', handleResponse);
        reject(new Error(
          `Custom mode read timeout after ${this.options.inquiryTimeout}ms for slot ${slot}. ` +
          'The device may be unresponsive or the slot may be empty. ' +
          'Troubleshooting steps: 1) Verify device connection, ' +
          '2) Check if custom mode exists in the specified slot, ' +
          '3) Try reading a different slot, 4) Power cycle the device.'
        ));
      }, this.options.inquiryTimeout);

      const handleResponse = (message: MidiMessage) => {
        if (message.type === 'sysex') {
          try {
            const parsed = SysExParser.parse([...message.data]);

            if (parsed.type === 'custom_mode_response') {
              clearTimeout(timeout);
              this.midi.removeListener('sysex', handleResponse);

              const response = this.validateCustomModeResponse(parsed);
              resolve({
                slot: response.slot ?? slot,
                name: response.name || `Custom ${slot + 1}`,
                controls: response.controls || {},
                colors: response.colors || {},
              });
            }
          } catch {
            // Ignore parse errors
          }
        }
      };

      this.midi.on('sysex', handleResponse);

      // Send custom mode read request
      const message = SysExParser.buildCustomModeReadRequest(slot);
      this.sendSysEx(message);
    });
  }

  /**
   * Write custom mode to device
   *
   * UPDATED (Issue #36 Fix): Now includes slot pre-selection to ensure
   * device firmware accepts write operations to inactive slots.
   */
  async writeCustomMode(slot: number, mode: CustomMode): Promise<void> {
    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
    }

    // NEW: Select target slot before write to prevent firmware rejection (status 0x9)
    console.log(`[DeviceManager] Selecting slot ${slot} before write`);
    await this.selectTemplate(slot);

    // NEW: Wait for device to process slot selection (100ms conservative delay)
    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 100));

    // EXISTING: Write to now-active slot
    const modeData = {
      slot,
      name: mode.name,
      controls: mode.controls,
      colors: mode.colors,
    };

    const validatedModeData = this.validateCustomModeData(modeData);
    const message = SysExParser.buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot, validatedModeData);
    await this.sendSysEx(message);
  }

  /**
   * Get current device status
   */
  getStatus(): DeviceStatus {
    const status: DeviceStatus = {
      connected: this.connectionState === 'connected',
      state: this.connectionState,
      deviceInfo: this.deviceInfo,
      currentMode: this.currentMode,
    };

    if (this.deviceInfo) {
      status.lastSeen = new Date();
    }

    return status;
  }


  /**
   * Validate device inquiry response with proper type checking
   */
  private validateDeviceInquiryResponse(response: unknown): DeviceInquiryResponse {
    const schema = z.object({
      type: z.literal('device_inquiry_response'),
      manufacturerId: z.array(z.number().min(0).max(127)),
      deviceFamily: z.number().optional(),
      deviceModel: z.number().optional(),
      familyCode: z.number().optional(),
      familyMember: z.number().optional(),
      firmwareVersion: z.array(z.number()).optional(),
      softwareRevision: z.array(z.number()).optional(),
      serialNumber: z.union([z.string(), z.array(z.number())]).optional(),
    });

    try {
      const validated = schema.parse(response);
      // Ensure serialNumber is in the correct format (number array)
      const serialNumberArray = validated.serialNumber
        ? (typeof validated.serialNumber === 'string'
          ? validated.serialNumber.split('').map(c => c.charCodeAt(0))
          : validated.serialNumber)
        : undefined;

      const result: DeviceInquiryResponse = {
        manufacturerId: validated.manufacturerId,
        deviceFamily: validated.deviceFamily ?? validated.familyCode ?? 0,
        deviceModel: validated.deviceModel ?? validated.familyMember ?? 0,
        firmwareVersion: validated.firmwareVersion ?? validated.softwareRevision ?? [],
        ...(serialNumberArray ? { serialNumber: serialNumberArray } : {}),
        // Include optional properties
        ...(validated.familyCode !== undefined ? { familyCode: validated.familyCode } : {}),
        ...(validated.familyMember !== undefined ? { familyMember: validated.familyMember } : {}),
        ...(validated.softwareRevision !== undefined ? { softwareRevision: validated.softwareRevision } : {}),
      };

      return result;
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Invalid device inquiry response format: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate device info with proper typing
   */
  private validateDeviceInfo(info: unknown): LaunchControlXL3Info {
    const schema = z.object({
      manufacturerId: z.string(),
      deviceFamily: z.number(),
      modelNumber: z.number(),
      firmwareVersion: z.string(),
      serialNumber: z.string().optional(),
      deviceName: z.string().optional(),
      portInfo: z.any().optional(), // MidiPortInfo type is complex, allow any for now
    });

    try {
      const validated = schema.parse(info);
      // Construct object with only defined optional properties
      const result: LaunchControlXL3Info = {
        manufacturerId: validated.manufacturerId,
        deviceFamily: validated.deviceFamily,
        modelNumber: validated.modelNumber,
        firmwareVersion: validated.firmwareVersion,
        ...(validated.serialNumber !== undefined && { serialNumber: validated.serialNumber }),
        ...(validated.deviceName !== undefined && { deviceName: validated.deviceName }),
        ...(validated.portInfo !== undefined && { portInfo: validated.portInfo }),
      };

      return result;
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Invalid device info format: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate custom mode response with type guards
   */
  private validateCustomModeResponse(response: unknown): { slot?: number; name?: string; controls?: any; colors?: any } {
    const schema = z.object({
      type: z.literal('custom_mode_response'),
      slot: z.number().min(0).max(15).optional(),
      name: z.string().optional(),
      controls: z.any().optional(), // Complex type, validate separately
      colors: z.any().optional(),
    });

    try {
      const validated = schema.parse(response);
      const result: { slot?: number; name?: string; controls?: any; colors?: any } = {};

      if (validated.slot !== undefined) {
        result.slot = validated.slot;
      }
      if (validated.name !== undefined) {
        result.name = validated.name;
      }
      if (validated.controls !== undefined) {
        result.controls = validated.controls;
      }
      if (validated.colors !== undefined) {
        result.colors = validated.colors;
      }

      return result;
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Invalid custom mode response format: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate custom mode data before sending
   */
  private validateCustomModeData(data: unknown): any {
    const schema = z.object({
      slot: z.number().min(0).max(15),
      name: z.string(),
      controls: z.any(),
      colors: z.any(),
    });

    try {
      return schema.parse(data);
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Invalid custom mode data format: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate template change response with type guards
   */
  private validateTemplateChangeResponse(response: unknown): { templateNumber: number } {
    const schema = z.object({
      type: z.literal('template_change'),
      templateNumber: z.number().min(0).max(15),
    });

    try {
      return schema.parse(response);
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Invalid template change response format: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Clean up resources
   */
  async cleanup(): Promise<void> {
    this.clearTimers();
    await this.disconnect();
    await this.midi.cleanup();
    this.removeAllListeners();
  }
}

export default DeviceManager;

/**
 * Validation Test for Issue #36: Slot Selection Hypothesis
 * 
 * Hypothesis: Device requires template change (0x77) before write (0x45) 
 * to accept writes to inactive slots.
 * 
 * This script performs empirical validation when a Launch Control XL3 device is available.
 */

import { DeviceManager } from '../src/DeviceManager';
import { MIDIInterface } from '../src/midi/MIDIInterface';
import { CustomModeConfig } from '../src/types';

const DELAY_MS = 100;

async function delay(ms: number): Promise<void> {
  return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, ms));
}

async function runValidationTests() {
  console.log('=== Issue #36 Slot Selection Hypothesis Validation ===\n');
  
  const midiInterface = new MIDIInterface();
  await midiInterface.initialize();
  
  const deviceManager = new DeviceManager(midiInterface);
  
  try {
    // Test 1: Baseline - Write to active slot (should succeed)
    console.log('Test 1: Baseline - Write to Active Slot');
    console.log('Prerequisites: Ensure device is physically on slot 1');
    console.log('Action: Reading current config from slot 1...');
    
    const currentConfig = await deviceManager.fetchCustomMode();
    console.log('‚úì Read successful from active slot 1');
    
    // Make a trivial modification
    const modifiedConfig = {
      ...currentConfig,
      name: currentConfig.name + '_test'
    };
    
    console.log('Action: Writing modified config back to slot 1...');
    await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(modifiedConfig);
    console.log('‚úì Test 1 PASSED: Write to active slot succeeded\n');
    
    // Test 2: Validation - Template selection + write to inactive slot
    console.log('Test 2: Validation - Template Selection + Write to Inactive Slot');
    console.log('Prerequisites: Device physically on slot 1');
    console.log('Action: Programmatically selecting slot 3...');
    
    // Send template change to slot 3 (template index 2, 0-based)
    await deviceManager.selectTemplate(2);
    console.log('‚úì Template change command sent (0x77 to slot 3)');
    
    console.log(`Action: Waiting ${DELAY_MS}ms for device to process...`);
    await delay(DELAY_MS);
    
    console.log('Action: Writing config to slot 3...');
    try {
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(modifiedConfig);
      console.log('‚úì Test 2 PASSED: Write to inactive slot succeeded after template selection!');
      console.log('  HYPOTHESIS CONFIRMED: Template selection (0x77) enables writes to inactive slots\n');
    } catch (error: any) {
      console.log('‚úó Test 2 FAILED: Write to inactive slot failed even with template selection');
      console.log(`  Error: ${error.message}`);
      console.log('  HYPOTHESIS REJECTED: Template selection alone is insufficient\n');
    }
    
    // Test 3: Control - Write without selection (should fail)
    console.log('Test 3: Control - Write Without Template Selection');
    console.log('Prerequisites: Device physically on slot 1');
    console.log('Action: Attempting direct write to slot 3 without template selection...');
    
    // First, ensure we're back to slot 1
    await deviceManager.selectTemplate(0);
    await delay(DELAY_MS);
    
    try {
      // This should fail with status 0x9
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(modifiedConfig);
      console.log('‚úó Test 3 FAILED: Write succeeded when it should have been rejected');
      console.log('  This is unexpected - device may already be on slot 3 from Test 2\n');
    } catch (error: any) {
      if (error.message.includes('0x9') || error.message.includes('rejected')) {
        console.log('‚úì Test 3 PASSED: Write rejected as expected (status 0x9)');
        console.log('  Confirms that writes to inactive slots are rejected without template selection\n');
      } else {
        console.log('‚úó Test 3 INCONCLUSIVE: Write failed but not with expected error');
        console.log(`  Error: ${error.message}\n`);
      }
    }
    
    // Summary
    console.log('=== Validation Summary ===');
    console.log('If Test 2 passed and Test 3 passed:');
    console.log('  HYPOTHESIS CONFIRMED: Template selection (0x77) is required before writes to inactive slots');
    console.log('\nRecommendations if hypothesis confirmed:');
    console.log('  1. Implement automatic template selection in writeCustomMode()');
    console.log('  2. Use 100ms delay after template selection');
    console.log('  3. Update documentation to reflect this requirement');
    console.log('  4. Add tests for cross-slot write operations');
    
  } catch (error: any) {
    console.error('Test suite failed with error:', error.message);
    throw error;
  } finally {
    await midiInterface.dispose();
  }
}

// Run if called directly
if (require.main === module) {
  runValidationTests()
    .then(() => {
      console.log('\n‚úì Validation complete');
      process.exit(0);
    })
    .catch((error) => {
      console.error('\n‚úó Validation failed:', error);
      process.exit(1);
    });
}

export { runValidationTests };
EOF
```

cat > /Users/orion/work/ol_dsp/modules/audio-control/docs/1.20/issues/36/validation-report.md << 'EOF'
# Issue #36: Slot Selection Hypothesis - Validation Report

**Date**: 2025-10-12  
**Status**: Ready for Empirical Testing  
**Device Required**: Launch Control XL3

## Hypothesis

Device firmware requires template selection command (0x77) to be sent before write command (0x45) when writing to a slot that is not currently active on the physical device.

## Evidence Analysis

### Code Review Findings

1. **DeviceManager Implementation**
   - Location: `src/DeviceManager.ts`
   - Current `writeCustomMode()` does NOT send template selection before write
   - No automatic slot switching mechanism exists
   - Method assumes target slot is already active on device

2. **Protocol Support**
   - Location: `src/midi/SysexProtocol.ts`
   - Template selection command (0x77) IS implemented: `TEMPLATE_CHANGE`
   - Command format: `F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 <template> F7`
   - Template parameter: 0-7 for slots 1-8 (0-based indexing)

3. **Missing Implementation**
   - DeviceManager lacks `selectTemplate()` method
   - No timing delay mechanism after template selection
   - No error handling for status 0x9 rejection

### Backup Data Analysis

**Backup files examined**: `backup/factory-user1.yaml` through `backup/factory-user8.yaml`

**Findings**:
- All backup files are complete custom mode configurations
- No MIDI traffic logs showing actual device communication
- Cannot determine from backups whether template selection was used
- Files represent successful reads, but don't show the protocol sequence

### Testing Infrastructure

**Existing test utilities**:
- `utils/test-fetch-custom-mode-node.ts` - Basic fetch test
- No test for cross-slot write operations
- No test for template selection mechanism

**Created for validation**:
- `utils/validate-slot-selection-hypothesis.ts` - Comprehensive validation test suite

## Validation Test Plan

### Prerequisites
- Launch Control XL3 device connected via USB
- Node.js with MIDI support (node-midi package)
- Device initialized in User mode

### Test Sequence

#### Test 1: Baseline - Write to Active Slot
**Purpose**: Establish that writes work when slot is physically active

**Setup**:
- Physically select slot 1 on device
- Read current configuration from slot 1
- Modify configuration (trivial change)
- Write back to slot 1

**Expected**: Success - establishes baseline functionality

#### Test 2: Validation - Template Selection + Write to Inactive Slot
**Purpose**: Validate hypothesis that template selection enables cross-slot writes

**Setup**:
- Device physically on slot 1
- Programmatically send template change: `F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 02 F7` (select slot 3)
- Wait 100ms for device processing
- Write modified configuration to slot 3

**Expected if hypothesis correct**: Success
**Expected if hypothesis incorrect**: Failure with status 0x9

#### Test 3: Control - Write Without Selection
**Purpose**: Confirm that writes fail without template selection

**Setup**:
- Device physically on slot 1
- Reset to slot 1 programmatically
- Attempt direct write to slot 3 without template selection

**Expected**: Failure with status 0x9 rejection

### Running the Tests

```bash
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Run validation test suite
npm run validate:slot-selection
# OR
npx tsx utils/validate-slot-selection-hypothesis.ts
```

## Implementation Requirements (if hypothesis confirmed)

### 1. Add selectTemplate Method to DeviceManager

```typescript
async selectTemplate(templateIndex: number): Promise<void> {
  if (templateIndex < 0 || templateIndex > 7) {
    throw new Error(`Invalid template index: ${templateIndex}. Must be 0-7`);
  }
  
  const message = SysexProtocol.createTemplateChange(templateIndex);
  await this.midiInterface.sendSysex(message);
}
```

### 2. Update writeCustomMode with Automatic Selection

```typescript
async writeCustomMode(config: CustomModeConfig, targetSlot?: number): Promise<void> {
  // If target slot specified and different from current, select it first
  if (targetSlot !== undefined) {
    await this.selectTemplate(targetSlot);
    await this.delay(100); // Wait for device to process template change
  }
  
  // Existing write logic...
}
```

### 3. Add Delay Utility

```typescript
private delay(ms: number): Promise<void> {
  return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, ms));
}
```

### 4. Update Documentation

- Document template selection requirement in PROTOCOL.md
- Add examples of cross-slot write operations
- Document timing requirements (100ms delay)

## Alternative Hypotheses (if primary hypothesis fails)

1. **Two-step activation**: Device requires both template selection AND some acknowledgment
2. **Save operation required**: Need explicit save command after template selection
3. **Physical requirement**: Device cannot write to inactive slots programmatically at all
4. **Timing issue**: 100ms delay insufficient, needs longer settling time

## Timing Recommendations

Based on similar MIDI device behavior patterns:
- **Initial recommendation**: 100ms delay after template selection
- **Conservative approach**: 200ms if 100ms proves insufficient
- **Maximum tested**: Up to 500ms if device is particularly slow

## Success Criteria

Hypothesis is **CONFIRMED** if:
- Test 1 passes (baseline works)
- Test 2 passes (write succeeds after template selection)
- Test 3 passes (write fails without template selection)

Hypothesis is **REJECTED** if:
- Test 2 fails despite template selection
- Need to investigate alternative hypotheses

## Next Steps

1. **If device available**: Run validation test suite immediately
2. **If hypothesis confirmed**: Implement automatic template selection in DeviceManager
3. **If hypothesis rejected**: Investigate alternative approaches (see Alternative Hypotheses)
4. **Document findings**: Update workplan with empirical results

## Files Modified/Created

- **Created**: `utils/validate-slot-selection-hypothesis.ts` - Validation test suite
- **Created**: `docs/1.20/issues/36/validation-report.md` - This report
- **To modify** (if confirmed): `src/DeviceManager.ts` - Add template selection support

## References

- **Issue**: #36 - Device rejects writes to inactive slots
- **Workplan**: `docs/1.20/issues/36/implementation/workplan.md`
- **Protocol**: `docs/PROTOCOL.md` - Section on Template Change (0x77)
- **Existing test**: `utils/test-fetch-custom-mode-node.ts`
EOF

 * Hypothesis: Device requires template change (0x77) before write (0x45) 
 * to accept writes to inactive slots.
 * 
 * This script performs empirical validation when a Launch Control XL3 device is available.
 */

import { DeviceManager } from '../src/DeviceManager';
import { MIDIInterface } from '../src/midi/MIDIInterface';
import { CustomModeConfig } from '../src/types';

const DELAY_MS = 100;

async function delay(ms: number): Promise<void> {
  return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, ms));
}

async function runValidationTests() {
  console.log('=== Issue #36 Slot Selection Hypothesis Validation ===\n');
  
  const midiInterface = new MIDIInterface();
  await midiInterface.initialize();
  
  const deviceManager = new DeviceManager(midiInterface);
  
  try {
    // Test 1: Baseline - Write to active slot (should succeed)
    console.log('Test 1: Baseline - Write to Active Slot');
    console.log('Prerequisites: Ensure device is physically on slot 1');
    console.log('Action: Reading current config from slot 1...');
    
    const currentConfig = await deviceManager.fetchCustomMode();
    console.log('‚úì Read successful from active slot 1');
    
    // Make a trivial modification
    const modifiedConfig = {
      ...currentConfig,
      name: currentConfig.name + '_test'
    };
    
    console.log('Action: Writing modified config back to slot 1...');
    await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(modifiedConfig);
    console.log('‚úì Test 1 PASSED: Write to active slot succeeded\n');
    
    // Test 2: Validation - Template selection + write to inactive slot
    console.log('Test 2: Validation - Template Selection + Write to Inactive Slot');
    console.log('Prerequisites: Device physically on slot 1');
    console.log('Action: Programmatically selecting slot 3...');
    
    // Send template change to slot 3 (template index 2, 0-based)
    await deviceManager.selectTemplate(2);
    console.log('‚úì Template change command sent (0x77 to slot 3)');
    
    console.log(`Action: Waiting ${DELAY_MS}ms for device to process...`);
    await delay(DELAY_MS);
    
    console.log('Action: Writing config to slot 3...');
    try {
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(modifiedConfig);
      console.log('‚úì Test 2 PASSED: Write to inactive slot succeeded after template selection!');
      console.log('  HYPOTHESIS CONFIRMED: Template selection (0x77) enables writes to inactive slots\n');
    } catch (error: any) {
      console.log('‚úó Test 2 FAILED: Write to inactive slot failed even with template selection');
      console.log(`  Error: ${error.message}`);
      console.log('  HYPOTHESIS REJECTED: Template selection alone is insufficient\n');
    }
    
    // Test 3: Control - Write without selection (should fail)
    console.log('Test 3: Control - Write Without Template Selection');
    console.log('Prerequisites: Device physically on slot 1');
    console.log('Action: Attempting direct write to slot 3 without template selection...');
    
    // First, ensure we're back to slot 1
    await deviceManager.selectTemplate(0);
    await delay(DELAY_MS);
    
    try {
      // This should fail with status 0x9
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(modifiedConfig);
      console.log('‚úó Test 3 FAILED: Write succeeded when it should have been rejected');
      console.log('  This is unexpected - device may already be on slot 3 from Test 2\n');
    } catch (error: any) {
      if (error.message.includes('0x9') || error.message.includes('rejected')) {
        console.log('‚úì Test 3 PASSED: Write rejected as expected (status 0x9)');
        console.log('  Confirms that writes to inactive slots are rejected without template selection\n');
      } else {
        console.log('‚úó Test 3 INCONCLUSIVE: Write failed but not with expected error');
        console.log(`  Error: ${error.message}\n`);
      }
    }
    
    // Summary
    console.log('=== Validation Summary ===');
    console.log('If Test 2 passed and Test 3 passed:');
    console.log('  HYPOTHESIS CONFIRMED: Template selection (0x77) is required before writes to inactive slots');
    console.log('\nRecommendations if hypothesis confirmed:');
    console.log('  1. Implement automatic template selection in writeCustomMode()');
    console.log('  2. Use 100ms delay after template selection');
    console.log('  3. Update documentation to reflect this requirement');
    console.log('  4. Add tests for cross-slot write operations');
    
  } catch (error: any) {
    console.error('Test suite failed with error:', error.message);
    throw error;
  } finally {
    await midiInterface.dispose();
  }
}

// Run if called directly
if (require.main === module) {
  runValidationTests()
    .then(() => {
      console.log('\n‚úì Validation complete');
      process.exit(0);
    })
    .catch((error) => {
      console.error('\n‚úó Validation failed:', error);
      process.exit(1);
    });
}

export { runValidationTests };
EOF
\```
