```
1‚Üí/**
     2‚Üí * Device Manager for Novation Launch Control XL 3
     3‚Üí *
     4‚Üí * Handles device discovery, connection, initialization, and communication
     5‚Üí * with the Launch Control XL 3 hardware via MIDI and SysEx.
     6‚Üí */
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíimport { EventEmitter } from 'eventemitter3';
     9‚Üíimport {
    10‚Üí  MidiInterface,
    11‚Üí  MidiPortInfo,
    12‚Üí  MidiMessage,
    13‚Üí  MidiBackendInterface
    14‚Üí} from '../core/MidiInterface.js';
    15‚Üíimport { SysExParser } from '../core/SysExParser.js';
    16‚Üíimport {
    17‚Üí  LaunchControlXL3Info,
    18‚Üí  DeviceMode,
    19‚Üí  DeviceConnectionState,
    20‚Üí  CustomMode,
    21‚Üí  DeviceInquiryResponse
    22‚Üí} from '../types/index.js';
    23‚Üíimport { z } from 'zod';
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üíexport interface DeviceManagerOptions {
    26‚Üí  midiBackend?: MidiBackendInterface | undefined;
    27‚Üí  autoConnect?: boolean;
    28‚Üí  deviceNameFilter?: string;
    29‚Üí  inquiryTimeout?: number;
    30‚Üí  retryAttempts?: number;
    31‚Üí  retryDelay?: number;
    32‚Üí}
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üíexport interface DeviceStatus {
    35‚Üí  connected: boolean;
    36‚Üí  state: DeviceConnectionState;
    37‚Üí  deviceInfo?: LaunchControlXL3Info | undefined;
    38‚Üí  currentMode?: DeviceMode | undefined;
    39‚Üí  lastSeen?: Date;
    40‚Üí  error?: string;
    41‚Üí}
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üíexport interface DeviceEvents {
    44‚Üí  'device:connected': (device: LaunchControlXL3Info) => void;
    45‚Üí  'device:disconnected': (reason?: string) => void;
    46‚Üí  'device:ready': (device: LaunchControlXL3Info) => void;
    47‚Üí  'device:error': (error: Error) => void;
    48‚Üí  'device:modeChanged': (mode: DeviceMode) => void;
    49‚Üí  'control:change': (control: string, value: number, channel?: number) => void;
    50‚Üí  'sysex:received': (message: number[]) => void;
    51‚Üí}
    52‚Üí
    53‚Üí/**
    54‚Üí * Main device manager for Launch Control XL 3
    55‚Üí */
    56‚Üíexport class DeviceManager extends EventEmitter {
    57‚Üí  private midi: MidiInterface;
    58‚Üí  private options: Required<Omit<DeviceManagerOptions, 'midiBackend'>> & { midiBackend?: MidiBackendInterface | undefined };
    59‚Üí  private deviceInfo?: LaunchControlXL3Info | undefined;
    60‚Üí  private connectionState: DeviceConnectionState = 'disconnected';
    61‚Üí  private inputPortId?: string | undefined;
    62‚Üí  private outputPortId?: string | undefined;
    63‚Üí  private currentMode?: DeviceMode | undefined;
    64‚Üí  private inquiryTimer?: NodeJS.Timeout | undefined;
    65‚Üí  private reconnectTimer?: NodeJS.Timeout | undefined;
    66‚Üí  private isInitializing = false;
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üí  constructor(options: DeviceManagerOptions = {}) {
    69‚Üí    super();
    70‚Üí
    71‚Üí    this.options = {
    72‚Üí      midiBackend: options.midiBackend,
    73‚Üí      autoConnect: options.autoConnect ?? true,
    74‚Üí      deviceNameFilter: options.deviceNameFilter ?? 'Launch Control XL',
    75‚Üí      inquiryTimeout: options.inquiryTimeout ?? 5000,
    76‚Üí      retryAttempts: options.retryAttempts ?? 3,
    77‚Üí      retryDelay: options.retryDelay ?? 1000,
    78‚Üí    };
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí    this.midi = new MidiInterface(this.options.midiBackend);
    81‚Üí    this.setupMidiHandlers();
    82‚Üí  }
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí  /**
    85‚Üí   * Initialize the device manager and optionally connect to device
    86‚Üí   */
    87‚Üí  async initialize(): Promise<void> {
    88‚Üí    try {
    89‚Üí      await this.midi.initialize();
    90‚Üí
    91‚Üí      if (this.options.autoConnect) {
    92‚Üí        await this.connect();
    93‚Üí      }
    94‚Üí    } catch (error) {
    95‚Üí      this.handleError(error as Error);
    96‚Üí      throw error;
    97‚Üí    }
    98‚Üí  }
    99‚Üí
   100‚Üí  /**
   101‚Üí   * Connect to Launch Control XL 3 device
   102‚Üí   */
   103‚Üí  async connect(): Promise<void> {
   104‚Üí    if (this.connectionState === 'connected' || this.connectionState === 'connecting') {
   105‚Üí      return;
   106‚Üí    }
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üí    this.setConnectionState('connecting');
   109‚Üí    this.isInitializing = true;
   110‚Üí
   111‚Üí    try {
   112‚Üí      // Find device ports
   113‚Üí      const { inputPort, outputPort } = await this.findDevicePorts();
   114‚Üí
   115‚Üí      if (!inputPort || !outputPort) {
   116‚Üí        throw new Error('Launch Control XL 3 not found');
   117‚Üí      }
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí      // Open ports
   120‚Üí      await this.midi.openInput(inputPort.id);
   121‚Üí      await this.midi.openOutput(outputPort.id);
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí      this.inputPortId = inputPort.id;
   124‚Üí      this.outputPortId = outputPort.id;
   125‚Üí
   126‚Üí      // Query device identity using complete 4-message handshake (NO FALLBACK)
   127‚Üí      const deviceInfo = await this.queryDeviceIdentity();
   128‚Üí      if (deviceInfo) {
   129‚Üí        this.deviceInfo = this.parseDeviceInfo(deviceInfo);
   130‚Üí      } else {
   131‚Üí        throw new Error('Device inquiry returned null response. Device may not be compatible or may be in an invalid state.');
   132‚Üí      }
   133‚Üí
   134‚Üí      // Initialize device settings
   135‚Üí      await this.initializeDevice();
   136‚Üí
   137‚Üí      this.setConnectionState('connected');
   138‚Üí      this.emit('device:connected', this.deviceInfo);
   139‚Üí      this.emit('device:ready', this.deviceInfo);
   140‚Üí
   141‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   142‚Üí      this.setConnectionState('error');
   143‚Üí      await this.disconnect();
   144‚Üí      throw error;
   145‚Üí    } finally {
   146‚Üí      this.isInitializing = false;
   147‚Üí    }
   148‚Üí  }
   149‚Üí
   150‚Üí  /**
   151‚Üí   * Disconnect from device
   152‚Üí   */
   153‚Üí  async disconnect(reason?: string): Promise<void> {
   154‚Üí    this.clearTimers();
   155‚Üí
   156‚Üí    if (this.inputPortId) {
   157‚Üí      await this.midi.closeInput();
   158‚Üí      this.inputPortId = undefined;
   159‚Üí    }
   160‚Üí
   161‚Üí    if (this.outputPortId) {
   162‚Üí      await this.midi.closeOutput();
   163‚Üí      this.outputPortId = undefined;
   164‚Üí    }
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí    if (this.connectionState !== 'disconnected') {
   167‚Üí      this.setConnectionState('disconnected');
   168‚Üí      this.emit('device:disconnected', reason);
   169‚Üí    }
   170‚Üí
   171‚Üí    this.deviceInfo = undefined;
   172‚Üí    this.currentMode = undefined;
   173‚Üí  }
   174‚Üí
   175‚Üí  /**
   176‚Üí   * Find Launch Control XL 3 ports
   177‚Üí   */
   178‚Üí  private async findDevicePorts(): Promise<{
   179‚Üí    inputPort?: MidiPortInfo | undefined;
   180‚Üí    outputPort?: MidiPortInfo | undefined;
   181‚Üí  }> {
   182‚Üí    const inputPorts = await this.midi.getInputPorts();
   183‚Üí    const outputPorts = await this.midi.getOutputPorts();
   184‚Üí
   185‚Üí    // For LCXL3, we need:
   186‚Üí    // - Input: "LCXL3 1 MIDI Out" (for receiving control changes from device)
   187‚Üí    // - Output: "LCXL3 1 MIDI In" (for sending SysEx/LED control to device)
   188‚Üí
   189‚Üí    // First try to find the specific ports we need
   190‚Üí    let inputPort = inputPorts.find(port =>
   191‚Üí      port.name === 'LCXL3 1 MIDI Out'
   192‚Üí    );
   193‚Üí
   194‚Üí    let outputPort = outputPorts.find(port =>
   195‚Üí      port.name === 'LCXL3 1 MIDI In'
   196‚Üí    );
   197‚Üí
   198‚Üí    // Fall back to filter-based search if specific ports not found
   199‚Üí    if (!inputPort) {
   200‚Üí      inputPort = inputPorts.find(port =>
   201‚Üí        port.name.includes(this.options.deviceNameFilter)
   202‚Üí      );
   203‚Üí    }
   204‚Üí
   205‚Üí    if (!outputPort) {
   206‚Üí      outputPort = outputPorts.find(port =>
   207‚Üí        port.name.includes(this.options.deviceNameFilter)
   208‚Üí      );
   209‚Üí    }
   210‚Üí
   211‚Üí    console.log('[DeviceManager] Found ports:', {
   212‚Üí      input: inputPort?.name,
   213‚Üí      output: outputPort?.name
   214‚Üí    });
   215‚Üí
   216‚Üí    return { inputPort, outputPort };
   217‚Üí  }
   218‚Üí
   219‚Üí  /**
   220‚Üí   * Query device identity using the complete 4-message handshake protocol
   221‚Üí   */
   222‚Üí  private async queryDeviceIdentity(): Promise<DeviceInquiryResponse | null> {
   223‚Üí    let serialNumber: string | undefined;
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí    // Step 1: Send Novation SYN
   226‚Üí    console.log('[DeviceManager] Handshake Step 1: Sending Novation SYN...');
   227‚Üí    const synMessage = SysExParser.buildNovationSyn();
   228‚Üí    await this.sendSysEx(synMessage);
   229‚Üí
   230‚Üí    // Step 2: Wait for SYN-ACK response
   231‚Üí    try {
   232‚Üí      const synAckData = await this.waitForMessage(
   233‚Üí        (data) => {
   234‚Üí          const result = SysExParser.parseNovationSynAck(data);
   235‚Üí          return result.valid;
   236‚Üí        },
   237‚Üí        this.options.inquiryTimeout,
   238‚Üí        'SYN-ACK'
   239‚Üí      );
   240‚Üí
   241‚Üí      const synAckResult = SysExParser.parseNovationSynAck(synAckData);
   242‚Üí      serialNumber = synAckResult.serialNumber;
   243‚Üí      console.log('[DeviceManager] Handshake Step 2: Received SYN-ACK with serial:', serialNumber);
   244‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   245‚Üí      throw new Error(
   246‚Üí        `Handshake failed at SYN-ACK step: ${(error as Error).message}. ` +
   247‚Üí        'Device may not support complete handshake protocol.'
   248‚Üí      );
   249‚Üí    }
   250‚Üí
   251‚Üí    // Step 3: Send Universal Device Inquiry (ACK) with correct device ID
   252‚Üí    console.log('[DeviceManager] Handshake Step 3: Sending Universal Device Inquiry (ACK)...');
   253‚Üí    const ackMessage = SysExParser.buildUniversalDeviceInquiry();
   254‚Üí    await this.sendSysEx(ackMessage);
   255‚Üí
   256‚Üí    // Step 4: Wait for Device Response
   257‚Üí    try {
   258‚Üí      const deviceResponseData = await this.waitForMessage(
   259‚Üí        (data) => SysExParser.isDeviceInquiryResponse(data),
   260‚Üí        this.options.inquiryTimeout,
   261‚Üí        'Device Response'
   262‚Üí      );
   263‚Üí
   264‚Üí      console.log('[DeviceManager] Handshake Step 4: Received device response');
   265‚Üí      const parsed = SysExParser.parse(deviceResponseData);
   266‚Üí
   267‚Üí      if (parsed.type === 'device_inquiry_response') {
   268‚Üí        // Cast parsed to DeviceInquiryResponse from SysExParser
   269‚Üí        const parsedResponse = parsed as any; // Type from SysExParser
   270‚Üí
   271‚Üí        // Create response object for validation with type field
   272‚Üí        const response = {
   273‚Üí          type: 'device_inquiry_response' as const,
   274‚Üí          manufacturerId: parsedResponse.manufacturerId || [],
   275‚Üí          deviceFamily: parsedResponse.familyCode || 0,
   276‚Üí          deviceModel: parsedResponse.familyMember || 0,
   277‚Üí          firmwareVersion: parsedResponse.softwareRevision || [],
   278‚Üí          ...(serialNumber ? { serialNumber: serialNumber.split('').map(c => c.charCodeAt(0)) } : {}),
   279‚Üí          // Include optional properties if present
   280‚Üí          ...(parsedResponse.familyCode !== undefined ? { familyCode: parsedResponse.familyCode } : {}),
   281‚Üí          ...(parsedResponse.familyMember !== undefined ? { familyMember: parsedResponse.familyMember } : {}),
   282‚Üí          ...(parsedResponse.softwareRevision !== undefined ? { softwareRevision: parsedResponse.softwareRevision } : {}),
   283‚Üí        };
   284‚Üí        const validatedResponse = this.validateDeviceInquiryResponse(response);
   285‚Üí        return validatedResponse;
   286‚Üí      }
   287‚Üí
   288‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid device response type');
   289‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   290‚Üí      throw new Error(
   291‚Üí        `Handshake failed at device response step: ${(error as Error).message}. ` +
   292‚Üí        'Troubleshooting steps: 1) Verify device is powered and connected, ' +
   293‚Üí        '2) Check MIDI cable/USB connection, 3) Ensure device firmware is up to date.'
   294‚Üí      );
   295‚Üí    }
   296‚Üí  }
   297‚Üí
   298‚Üí  /**
   299‚Üí   * Wait for a specific MIDI message with timeout
   300‚Üí   */
   301‚Üí  private async waitForMessage(
   302‚Üí    validator: (data: number[]) => boolean,
   303‚Üí    timeoutMs: number,
   304‚Üí    messageName: string
   305‚Üí  ): Promise<number[]> {
   306‚Üí    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
   307‚Üí      const timeout = setTimeout(() => {
   308‚Üí        this.midi.removeListener('sysex', handleResponse);
   309‚Üí        reject(new Error(`Handshake timeout waiting for ${messageName} after ${timeoutMs}ms`));
   310‚Üí      }, timeoutMs);
   311‚Üí
   312‚Üí      const handleResponse = (message: MidiMessage) => {
   313‚Üí        if (message.type === 'sysex' && validator([...message.data])) {
   314‚Üí          clearTimeout(timeout);
   315‚Üí          this.midi.removeListener('sysex', handleResponse);
   316‚Üí          resolve([...message.data]);
   317‚Üí        }
   318‚Üí      };
   319‚Üí
   320‚Üí      this.midi.on('sysex', handleResponse);
   321‚Üí    });
   322‚Üí  }
   323‚Üí
   324‚Üí  /**
   325‚Üí   * Parse device info from inquiry response
   326‚Üí   */
   327‚Üí  private parseDeviceInfo(response: DeviceInquiryResponse): LaunchControlXL3Info {
   328‚Üí    const validatedInfo = this.validateDeviceInfo({
   329‚Üí      manufacturerId: response.manufacturerId.map(b =>
   330‚Üí        b.toString(16).padStart(2, '0')
   331‚Üí      ).join(' '),
   332‚Üí      deviceFamily: response.familyCode ?? response.deviceFamily ?? 0,
   333‚Üí      modelNumber: response.familyMember ?? response.deviceModel ?? 0,
   334‚Üí      firmwareVersion: response.softwareRevision ?
   335‚Üí        `${response.softwareRevision[0]}.${response.softwareRevision[1]}.${response.softwareRevision[2]}.${response.softwareRevision[3]}` :
   336‚Üí        (response.firmwareVersion ? Array.from(response.firmwareVersion).join('.') : 'unknown'),
   337‚Üí      serialNumber: typeof response.serialNumber === 'string' ?
   338‚Üí        response.serialNumber :
   339‚Üí        (response.serialNumber ? Array.from(response.serialNumber).join('') : undefined),
   340‚Üí    });
   341‚Üí
   342‚Üí    return validatedInfo;
   343‚Üí  }
   344‚Üí
   345‚Üí  /**
   346‚Üí   * Initialize device after connection
   347‚Üí   */
   348‚Üí  private async initializeDevice(): Promise<void> {
   349‚Üí    // Additional initialization steps can be added here
   350‚Üí    // For example: loading custom modes, setting initial LED states, etc.
   351‚Üí
   352‚Üí    // Set initial mode to User mode
   353‚Üí    await this.selectTemplate(0);
   354‚Üí  }
   355‚Üí
   356‚Üí  /**
   357‚Üí   * Setup MIDI event handlers
   358‚Üí   */
   359‚Üí  private setupMidiHandlers(): void {
   360‚Üí    this.midi.on('controlchange', (message: MidiMessage) => {
   361‚Üí      if (!this.isInitializing && this.connectionState === 'connected') {
   362‚Üí        const control = this.getControlName(message.controller!, message.channel!);
   363‚Üí        this.emit('control:change', control, message.value!, message.channel);
   364‚Üí      }
   365‚Üí    });
   366‚Üí
   367‚Üí    this.midi.on('sysex', (message: MidiMessage) => {
   368‚Üí      if (!this.isInitializing && this.connectionState === 'connected') {
   369‚Üí        this.emit('sysex:received', message.data);
   370‚Üí        this.handleSysExMessage([...message.data]);
   371‚Üí      }
   372‚Üí    });
   373‚Üí
   374‚Üí    this.midi.on('error', (error: Error) => {
   375‚Üí      this.handleError(error);
   376‚Üí    });
   377‚Üí  }
   378‚Üí
   379‚Üí  /**
   380‚Üí   * Handle incoming SysEx messages
   381‚Üí   */
   382‚Üí  private handleSysExMessage(data: number[]): void {
   383‚Üí    try {
   384‚Üí      const parsed = SysExParser.parse(data);
   385‚Üí
   386‚Üí      switch (parsed.type) {
   387‚Üí        case 'template_change':
   388‚Üí          const templateChange = this.validateTemplateChangeResponse(parsed);
   389‚Üí          this.currentMode = {
   390‚Üí            type: 'template',
   391‚Üí            slot: templateChange.templateNumber,
   392‚Üí          };
   393‚Üí          this.emit('device:modeChanged', this.currentMode);
   394‚Üí          break;
   395‚Üí
   396‚Üí        // Add more SysEx message handlers as needed
   397‚Üí      }
   398‚Üí    } catch {
   399‚Üí      // Ignore unrecognized SysEx messages
   400‚Üí    }
   401‚Üí  }
   402‚Üí
   403‚Üí  /**
   404‚Üí   * Get human-readable control name
   405‚Üí   */
   406‚Üí  private getControlName(controller: number, _channel: number): string {
   407‚Üí    // Map CC numbers to control names based on Launch Control XL 3 layout
   408‚Üí    const controlMap: Record<number, string> = {
   409‚Üí      // Send A knobs
   410‚Üí      13: 'sendA1', 14: 'sendA2', 15: 'sendA3', 16: 'sendA4',
   411‚Üí      17: 'sendA5', 18: 'sendA6', 19: 'sendA7', 20: 'sendA8',
   412‚Üí
   413‚Üí      // Send B knobs
   414‚Üí      29: 'sendB1', 30: 'sendB2', 31: 'sendB3', 32: 'sendB4',
   415‚Üí      33: 'sendB5', 34: 'sendB6', 35: 'sendB7', 36: 'sendB8',
   416‚Üí
   417‚Üí      // Pan/Device knobs
   418‚Üí      49: 'pan1', 50: 'pan2', 51: 'pan3', 52: 'pan4',
   419‚Üí      53: 'pan5', 54: 'pan6', 55: 'pan7', 56: 'pan8',
   420‚Üí
   421‚Üí      // Faders
   422‚Üí      77: 'fader1', 78: 'fader2', 79: 'fader3', 80: 'fader4',
   423‚Üí      81: 'fader5', 82: 'fader6', 83: 'fader7', 84: 'fader8',
   424‚Üí    };
   425‚Üí
   426‚Üí    return controlMap[controller] || `cc${controller}`;
   427‚Üí  }
   428‚Üí
   429‚Üí  /**
   430‚Üí   * Set connection state
   431‚Üí   */
   432‚Üí  private setConnectionState(state: DeviceConnectionState): void {
   433‚Üí    this.connectionState = state;
   434‚Üí  }
   435‚Üí
   436‚Üí  /**
   437‚Üí   * Handle errors
   438‚Üí   */
   439‚Üí  private handleError(error: Error): void {
   440‚Üí    console.error('[DeviceManager] Error:', error.message);
   441‚Üí    this.emit('device:error', error);
   442‚Üí
   443‚Üí    if (this.connectionState === 'connected') {
   444‚Üí      this.attemptReconnect();
   445‚Üí    }
   446‚Üí  }
   447‚Üí
   448‚Üí  /**
   449‚Üí   * Attempt to reconnect after connection loss
   450‚Üí   */
   451‚Üí  private attemptReconnect(): void {
   452‚Üí    if (this.reconnectTimer) {
   453‚Üí      return;
   454‚Üí    }
   455‚Üí
   456‚Üí    let attempts = 0;
   457‚Üí
   458‚Üí    const tryReconnect = async () => {
   459‚Üí      if (attempts >= this.options.retryAttempts) {
   460‚Üí        this.clearTimers();
   461‚Üí        await this.disconnect('Max reconnection attempts reached');
   462‚Üí        return;
   463‚Üí      }
   464‚Üí
   465‚Üí      attempts++;
   466‚Üí
   467‚Üí      try {
   468‚Üí        await this.connect();
   469‚Üí        this.clearTimers();
   470‚Üí      } catch {
   471‚Üí        this.reconnectTimer = setTimeout(tryReconnect, this.options.retryDelay);
   472‚Üí      }
   473‚Üí    };
   474‚Üí
   475‚Üí    this.reconnectTimer = setTimeout(tryReconnect, this.options.retryDelay);
   476‚Üí  }
   477‚Üí
   478‚Üí  /**
   479‚Üí   * Clear all timers
   480‚Üí   */
   481‚Üí  private clearTimers(): void {
   482‚Üí    if (this.inquiryTimer) {
   483‚Üí      clearTimeout(this.inquiryTimer as NodeJS.Timeout);
   484‚Üí      this.inquiryTimer = undefined;
   485‚Üí    }
   486‚Üí
   487‚Üí    if (this.reconnectTimer) {
   488‚Üí      clearTimeout(this.reconnectTimer as NodeJS.Timeout);
   489‚Üí      this.reconnectTimer = undefined;
   490‚Üí    }
   491‚Üí  }
   492‚Üí
   493‚Üí  /**
   494‚Üí   * Send SysEx message to device
   495‚Üí   */
   496‚Üí  async sendSysEx(data: number[]): Promise<void> {
   497‚Üí    if (!this.outputPortId) {
   498‚Üí      throw new Error('Device not connected');
   499‚Üí    }
   500‚Üí
   501‚Üí    await this.midi.sendMessage(data);
   502‚Üí  }
   503‚Üí
   504‚Üí  /**
   505‚Üí   * Send CC message to device
   506‚Üí   */
   507‚Üí  async sendCC(controller: number, value: number, channel: number = 0): Promise<void> {
   508‚Üí    if (!this.outputPortId) {
   509‚Üí      throw new Error('Device not connected');
   510‚Üí    }
   511‚Üí
   512‚Üí    // Build CC message: status byte (0xB0 + channel), controller, value
   513‚Üí    const data = [0xB0 | (channel & 0x0F), controller, value];
   514‚Üí    await this.midi.sendMessage(data);
   515‚Üí  }
   516‚Üí
   517‚Üí  /**
   518‚Üí   * Select a template slot (0-15)
   519‚Üí   */
   520‚Üí  async selectTemplate(slot: number): Promise<void> {
   521‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   522‚Üí      throw new Error('Template slot must be 0-15');
   523‚Üí    }
   524‚Üí
   525‚Üí    // Send template change message
   526‚Üí    const message = SysExParser.buildTemplateChange(slot);
   527‚Üí    await this.sendSysEx(message);
   528‚Üí
   529‚Üí    this.currentMode = {
   530‚Üí      type: 'template',
   531‚Üí      slot,
   532‚Üí    };
   533‚Üí
   534‚Üí    this.emit('device:modeChanged', this.currentMode);
   535‚Üí  }
   536‚Üí
   537‚Üí  /**
   538‚Üí   * Read custom mode from device
   539‚Üí   */
   540‚Üí  async readCustomMode(slot: number): Promise<CustomMode> {
   541‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   542‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   543‚Üí    }
   544‚Üí
   545‚Üí    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
   546‚Üí      const timeout = setTimeout(() => {
   547‚Üí        this.midi.removeListener('sysex', handleResponse);
   548‚Üí        reject(new Error(
   549‚Üí          `Custom mode read timeout after ${this.options.inquiryTimeout}ms for slot ${slot}. ` +
   550‚Üí          'The device may be unresponsive or the slot may be empty. ' +
   551‚Üí          'Troubleshooting steps: 1) Verify device connection, ' +
   552‚Üí          '2) Check if custom mode exists in the specified slot, ' +
   553‚Üí          '3) Try reading a different slot, 4) Power cycle the device.'
   554‚Üí        ));
   555‚Üí      }, this.options.inquiryTimeout);
   556‚Üí
   557‚Üí      const handleResponse = (message: MidiMessage) => {
   558‚Üí        if (message.type === 'sysex') {
   559‚Üí          try {
   560‚Üí            const parsed = SysExParser.parse([...message.data]);
   561‚Üí
   562‚Üí            if (parsed.type === 'custom_mode_response') {
   563‚Üí              clearTimeout(timeout);
   564‚Üí              this.midi.removeListener('sysex', handleResponse);
   565‚Üí
   566‚Üí              const response = this.validateCustomModeResponse(parsed);
   567‚Üí              resolve({
   568‚Üí                slot: response.slot ?? slot,
   569‚Üí                name: response.name || `Custom ${slot + 1}`,
   570‚Üí                controls: response.controls || {},
   571‚Üí                colors: response.colors || {},
   572‚Üí              });
   573‚Üí            }
   574‚Üí          } catch {
   575‚Üí            // Ignore parse errors
   576‚Üí          }
   577‚Üí        }
   578‚Üí      };
   579‚Üí
   580‚Üí      this.midi.on('sysex', handleResponse);
   581‚Üí
   582‚Üí      // Send custom mode read request
   583‚Üí      const message = SysExParser.buildCustomModeReadRequest(slot);
   584‚Üí      this.sendSysEx(message);
   585‚Üí    });
   586‚Üí  }
   587‚Üí
   588‚Üí  /**
   589‚Üí   * Write custom mode to device
   590‚Üí   *
   591‚Üí   * UPDATED (Issue #36 Fix): Now includes slot pre-selection to ensure
   592‚Üí   * device firmware accepts write operations to inactive slots.
   593‚Üí   */
   594‚Üí  async writeCustomMode(slot: number, mode: CustomMode): Promise<void> {
   595‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   596‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   597‚Üí    }
   598‚Üí
   599‚Üí    // NEW: Select target slot before write to prevent firmware rejection (status 0x9)
   600‚Üí    console.log(`[DeviceManager] Selecting slot ${slot} before write`);
   601‚Üí    await this.selectTemplate(slot);
   602‚Üí
   603‚Üí    // NEW: Wait for device to process slot selection (100ms conservative delay)
   604‚Üí    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 100));
   605‚Üí
   606‚Üí    // EXISTING: Write to now-active slot
   607‚Üí    const modeData = {
   608‚Üí      slot,
   609‚Üí      name: mode.name,
   610‚Üí      controls: mode.controls,
   611‚Üí      colors: mode.colors,
   612‚Üí    };
   613‚Üí
   614‚Üí    const validatedModeData = this.validateCustomModeData(modeData);
   615‚Üí    const message = SysExParser.buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot, validatedModeData);
   616‚Üí    await this.sendSysEx(message);
   617‚Üí  }
   618‚Üí
   619‚Üí  /**
   620‚Üí   * Get current device status
   621‚Üí   */
   622‚Üí  getStatus(): DeviceStatus {
   623‚Üí    const status: DeviceStatus = {
   624‚Üí      connected: this.connectionState === 'connected',
   625‚Üí      state: this.connectionState,
   626‚Üí      deviceInfo: this.deviceInfo,
   627‚Üí      currentMode: this.currentMode,
   628‚Üí    };
   629‚Üí
   630‚Üí    if (this.deviceInfo) {
   631‚Üí      status.lastSeen = new Date();
   632‚Üí    }
   633‚Üí
   634‚Üí    return status;
   635‚Üí  }
   636‚Üí
   637‚Üí
   638‚Üí  /**
   639‚Üí   * Validate device inquiry response with proper type checking
   640‚Üí   */
   641‚Üí  private validateDeviceInquiryResponse(response: unknown): DeviceInquiryResponse {
   642‚Üí    const schema = z.object({
   643‚Üí      type: z.literal('device_inquiry_response'),
   644‚Üí      manufacturerId: z.array(z.number().min(0).max(127)),
   645‚Üí      deviceFamily: z.number().optional(),
   646‚Üí      deviceModel: z.number().optional(),
   647‚Üí      familyCode: z.number().optional(),
   648‚Üí      familyMember: z.number().optional(),
   649‚Üí      firmwareVersion: z.array(z.number()).optional(),
   650‚Üí      softwareRevision: z.array(z.number()).optional(),
   651‚Üí      serialNumber: z.union([z.string(), z.array(z.number())]).optional(),
   652‚Üí    });
   653‚Üí
   654‚Üí    try {
   655‚Üí      const validated = schema.parse(response);
   656‚Üí      // Ensure serialNumber is in the correct format (number array)
   657‚Üí      const serialNumberArray = validated.serialNumber
   658‚Üí        ? (typeof validated.serialNumber === 'string'
   659‚Üí          ? validated.serialNumber.split('').map(c => c.charCodeAt(0))
   660‚Üí          : validated.serialNumber)
   661‚Üí        : undefined;
   662‚Üí
   663‚Üí      const result: DeviceInquiryResponse = {
   664‚Üí        manufacturerId: validated.manufacturerId,
   665‚Üí        deviceFamily: validated.deviceFamily ?? validated.familyCode ?? 0,
   666‚Üí        deviceModel: validated.deviceModel ?? validated.familyMember ?? 0,
   667‚Üí        firmwareVersion: validated.firmwareVersion ?? validated.softwareRevision ?? [],
   668‚Üí        ...(serialNumberArray ? { serialNumber: serialNumberArray } : {}),
   669‚Üí        // Include optional properties
   670‚Üí        ...(validated.familyCode !== undefined ? { familyCode: validated.familyCode } : {}),
   671‚Üí        ...(validated.familyMember !== undefined ? { familyMember: validated.familyMember } : {}),
   672‚Üí        ...(validated.softwareRevision !== undefined ? { softwareRevision: validated.softwareRevision } : {}),
   673‚Üí      };
   674‚Üí
   675‚Üí      return result;
   676‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   677‚Üí      throw new Error(`Invalid device inquiry response format: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`);
   678‚Üí    }
   679‚Üí  }
   680‚Üí
   681‚Üí  /**
   682‚Üí   * Validate device info with proper typing

   684‚Üí  private validateDeviceInfo(info: unknown): LaunchControlXL3Info {
   685‚Üí    const schema = z.object({
   686‚Üí      manufacturerId: z.string(),

   693‚Üí    });
   694‚Üí
   695‚Üí    try {
   696‚Üí      const validated = schema.parse(info);

   706‚Üí      };
   707‚Üí
   708‚Üí      return result;

   711‚Üí    }
   712‚Üí  }

   714‚Üí  /**
   715‚Üí   * Validate custom mode response with type guards
   716‚Üí   */
   717‚Üí  private validateCustomModeResponse(response: unknown): { slot?: number; name?: string; controls?: any; colors?: any } {
   718‚Üí    const schema = z.object({
   719‚Üí      type: z.literal('custom_mode_response'),
   720‚Üí      slot: z.number().min(0).max(15).optional(),
   721‚Üí      name: z.string().optional(),

   723‚Üí      colors: z.any().optional(),
   724‚Üí    });
   725‚Üí
   726‚Üí    try {
   727‚Üí      const validated = schema.parse(response);
   728‚Üí      const result: { slot?: number; name?: string; controls?: any; colors?: any } = {};
   729‚Üí
   730‚Üí      if (validated.slot !== undefined) {
   731‚Üí        result.slot = validated.slot;
   732‚Üí      }
   733‚Üí      if (validated.name !== undefined) {
   734‚Üí        result.name = validated.name;
   735‚Üí      }
   736‚Üí      if (validated.controls !== undefined) {
   737‚Üí        result.controls = validated.controls;
   738‚Üí      }
   739‚Üí      if (validated.colors !== undefined) {
   740‚Üí        result.colors = validated.colors;
   741‚Üí      }
   742‚Üí
   743‚Üí      return result;
   744‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   745‚Üí      throw new Error(`Invalid custom mode response format: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`);
   746‚Üí    }
   747‚Üí  }
   748‚Üí
   749‚Üí  /**
   750‚Üí   * Validate custom mode data before sending

   756‚Üí      controls: z.any(),
   757‚Üí      colors: z.any(),
```

```
    96‚Üí  async initialize(): Promise<void> {
    97‚Üí    if (this.isInitialized) {
    98‚Üí      return;

   100‚Üí

   144‚Üí  async openInput(portIdOrName: string): Promise<void> {
   145‚Üí    if (!this.isInitialized) {
   146‚Üí      throw new Error('MidiInterface not initialized');
   147‚Üí    }
   148‚Üí
   149‚Üí    if (!this.backend) {
   150‚Üí      throw new Error('No MIDI backend available');
   151‚Üí    }
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üí    // Close existing input if open

   155‚Üí      await this.closeInput();

   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí    if (!port) {
   163‚Üí      throw new Error(`Input port not found: ${portIdOrName}`);
   164‚Üí    }
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí    // Open port
   167‚Üí    this.inputPort = await this.backend.openInput(port.id);
   168‚Üí

   170‚Üí    this.inputPort.onMessage = (message: MidiMessage) => {
   171‚Üí      this.handleIncomingMessage(message);
   172‚Üí    };
   173‚Üí
   174‚Üí    this.emit('connected', this.inputPort);
   175‚Üí  }
   176‚Üí
   177‚Üí  /**
   178‚Üí   * Open output port by ID or name
   179‚Üí   */
   180‚Üí  async openOutput(portIdOrName: string): Promise<void> {
   181‚Üí    if (!this.isInitialized) {
   182‚Üí      throw new Error('MidiInterface not initialized');
   183‚Üí    }
   184‚Üí
   185‚Üí    if (!this.backend) {
   186‚Üí      throw new Error('No MIDI backend available');
   187‚Üí    }
   188‚Üí
   189‚Üí    // Close existing output if open
   190‚Üí    if (this.outputPort) {
   191‚Üí      await this.closeOutput();
   192‚Üí    }
   193‚Üí
   194‚Üí    // Find port
   195‚Üí    const ports = await this.backend.getOutputPorts();
   196‚Üí    const port = ports.find((p) => p.id === portIdOrName || p.name === portIdOrName);
   197‚Üí
   198‚Üí    if (!port) {
   199‚Üí      throw new Error(`Output port not found: ${portIdOrName}`);
   200‚Üí    }
   201‚Üí
   202‚Üí    // Open port
   203‚Üí    this.outputPort = await this.backend.openOutput(port.id);
   204‚Üí    this.emit('connected', this.outputPort);
   205‚Üí  }
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí  /**
   208‚Üí   * Send MIDI message
   209‚Üí   */
   210‚Üí  async sendMessage(data: number[]): Promise<void> {
   211‚Üí    if (!this.outputPort) {
   212‚Üí      throw new Error('No output port open');
   213‚Üí    }
   214‚Üí
   215‚Üí    if (!this.backend) {
   216‚Üí      throw new Error('No MIDI backend available');
   217‚Üí    }
   218‚Üí
   219‚Üí    const message: MidiMessage = {
   220‚Üí      timestamp: Date.now(),
   221‚Üí      data,
   222‚Üí    };
   223‚Üí
   224‚Üí    await this.backend.sendMessage(this.outputPort, message);
   225‚Üí  }
   226‚Üí
   227‚Üí  /**
   228‚Üí   * Close input port
   229‚Üí   */
   230‚Üí  async closeInput(): Promise<void> {
   231‚Üí    if (this.inputPort && this.backend) {
   232‚Üí      await this.backend.closePort(this.inputPort);
   233‚Üí      this.emit('disconnected', this.inputPort);
   234‚Üí      this.inputPort = undefined;
   235‚Üí    }
   236‚Üí  }
   237‚Üí
   238‚Üí  /**
   239‚Üí   * Close output port
   240‚Üí   */
   241‚Üí  async closeOutput(): Promise<void> {
   242‚Üí    if (this.outputPort && this.backend) {
   243‚Üí      await this.backend.closePort(this.outputPort);
   244‚Üí      this.emit('disconnected', this.outputPort);
   245‚Üí      this.outputPort = undefined;
   246‚Üí    }
   247‚Üí  }
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí  /**
   250‚Üí   * Close all ports and cleanup
   251‚Üí   */
   252‚Üí  async cleanup(): Promise<void> {
   253‚Üí    await this.closeInput();
   254‚Üí    await this.closeOutput();
   255‚Üí
   256‚Üí    if (this.backend) {
   257‚Üí      await this.backend.cleanup();
   258‚Üí    }
   259‚Üí
   260‚Üí    this.isInitialized = false;
   261‚Üí    this.messageBuffer = [];
   262‚Üí  }
   263‚Üí
   264‚Üí  /**
   265‚Üí   * Get current connection status
   266‚Üí   */
   267‚Üí  isConnected(): boolean {
   268‚Üí    return !!(this.inputPort || this.outputPort);
   269‚Üí  }
   270‚Üí
   271‚Üí  /**
   272‚Üí   * Get buffered messages
   273‚Üí   */
   274‚Üí  getBufferedMessages(): MidiMessage[] {
   275‚Üí    return [...this.messageBuffer];
   276‚Üí  }
   277‚Üí
   278‚Üí  /**
   279‚Üí   * Clear message buffer
   280‚Üí   */
   281‚Üí  clearBuffer(): void {
   282‚Üí    this.messageBuffer = [];
   283‚Üí  }
   284‚Üí
   285‚Üí  /**
   286‚Üí   * Handle incoming MIDI message
   287‚Üí   */
   288‚Üí  private handleIncomingMessage(message: MidiMessage): void {
   289‚Üí    // Add to buffer
   290‚Üí    this.messageBuffer.push(message);
   291‚Üí
   292‚Üí    // Limit buffer size
   293‚Üí    if (this.messageBuffer.length > this.maxBufferSize) {
   294‚Üí      this.messageBuffer.shift();
   295‚Üí    }
   296‚Üí
   297‚Üí    // Parse and emit typed MIDI events
   298‚Üí    const data = message.data;
   299‚Üí    if (data.length > 0) {
   300‚Üí      const statusByte = data[0];
   301‚Üí      if (statusByte === undefined) return;
   302‚Üí      const channel = statusByte & 0x0f;
   303‚Üí      const messageType = statusByte & 0xf0;
   304‚Üí
   305‚Üí      const parsedMessage: MidiMessage = {
   306‚Üí        timestamp: message.timestamp,
   307‚Üí        data: data,
   308‚Üí        type: 'unknown',
   309‚Üí        channel,
   310‚Üí      };
   311‚Üí
   312‚Üí      switch (messageType) {
   313‚Üí        case 0xb0: // Control Change
   314‚Üí          parsedMessage.type = 'controlchange';
   315‚Üí          parsedMessage.controller = data[1] ?? 0;
   316‚Üí          parsedMessage.value = data[2] ?? 0;
   317‚Üí          this.emit('controlchange', parsedMessage);
   318‚Üí          break;
   319‚Üí
   320‚Üí        case 0x90: // Note On
   321‚Üí          parsedMessage.type = 'noteon';
   322‚Üí          parsedMessage.note = data[1] ?? 0;
   323‚Üí          parsedMessage.velocity = data[2] ?? 0;
   324‚Üí          this.emit('noteon', parsedMessage);
   325‚Üí          break;
   326‚Üí
   327‚Üí        case 0x80: // Note Off
   328‚Üí          parsedMessage.type = 'noteoff';
   329‚Üí          parsedMessage.note = data[1] ?? 0;
   330‚Üí          parsedMessage.velocity = data[2] ?? 0;
   331‚Üí          this.emit('noteoff', parsedMessage);
   332‚Üí          break;
   333‚Üí
   334‚Üí        case 0xf0: // System Exclusive
   335‚Üí          if (data[data.length - 1] === 0xf7) {
   336‚Üí            parsedMessage.type = 'sysex';
   337‚Üí            this.emit('sysex', parsedMessage);
   338‚Üí          }
   339‚Üí          break;
   340‚Üí      }
   341‚Üí
   342‚Üí      // Always emit the generic message event
   343‚Üí      this.emit('message', message);
   344‚Üí    }
   345‚Üí  }
   346‚Üí
   347‚Üí  /**
   348‚Üí   * Auto-detect available MIDI backend
   349‚Üí   */
   350‚Üí  // private async autoDetectBackend(): Promise<MidiBackendInterface> {
   351‚Üí  //   // Try Web MIDI API first (browser environment with native support)
   352‚Üí  //   try {
   353‚Üí  //     const { WebMidiBackend } = await import('./backends/WebMidiBackend.js');
   354‚Üí  //     if (WebMidiBackend.isAvailable()) {
   355‚Üí  //       return new WebMidiBackend();

   359‚Üí  //   }

   362‚Üí  //   try {
   363‚Üí  //     const { EasyMidiBackend } = await import('./backends/EasyMidiBackend.js');
   364‚Üí  //     const backend = new EasyMidiBackend();

   366‚Üí  //     return backend;
   367‚Üí  //   } catch (err) {
```

```
    14‚Üí/**
    15‚Üí * Convert CustomMode format to CustomModeMessage format for testing
    16‚Üí *
    17‚Üí * Takes object-based controls (e.g., { SEND_A1: {...}, SEND_B2: {...} })
    18‚Üí * and converts to array-based format with controlId properties that
    19‚Üí * buildCustomModeWriteRequest expects.
    20‚Üí */
    21‚Üífunction convertToCustomModeMessage(mode: any, slot: number): any {
    22‚Üí  const controls: any[] = [];
    23‚Üí  const colors: any[] = [];
    24‚Üí  const labels = new Map<number, string>();
    25‚Üí

    27‚Üí  if (mode.controls) {
    28‚Üí    for (const [key, control] of Object.entries(mode.controls)) {
    29‚Üí      const controlId = (CONTROL_IDS as any)[key];
    30‚Üí      if (controlId !== undefined) {
    31‚Üí        controls.push({
    32‚Üí          controlId,
    33‚Üí          channel: (control as any).channel ?? (control as any).midiChannel,
    34‚Üí          ccNumber: (control as any).cc ?? (control as any).ccNumber,

    45‚Üí  }
```

```typescript
/**
 * Mock MIDI Backend for testing
 *
 * Provides a test double for MidiBackendInterface that allows
 * controlled testing without real MIDI hardware.
 *
 * CRITICAL: This mocks the MidiBackendInterface, NOT the entire module.
 * Uses dependency injection pattern as required.
 */

import type {
  MidiBackendInterface,
  MidiPortInfo,
  MidiInputPort,
  MidiOutputPort,
  MidiPort,
  MidiMessage,
} from '@/core/MidiInterface';

/**
 * Mock implementation of MidiBackendInterface for testing
 */
export class MockMidiBackend implements MidiBackendInterface {
  private initialized = false;
  private inputPorts: MidiPortInfo[] = [];
  private outputPorts: MidiPortInfo[] = [];
  private openPorts = new Map<string, MockMidiPort>();
  private messageHandler?: ((message: MidiMessage) => void) | undefined;
  public sentMessages: number[][] = [];
  public simulatedResponses: number[][] = [];

  /**
   * Configure available MIDI ports for testing
   */
  configurePorts(options: {
    inputPorts?: MidiPortInfo[];
    outputPorts?: MidiPortInfo[];
  }): void {
    this.inputPorts = options.inputPorts ?? [];
    this.outputPorts = options.outputPorts ?? [];
  }

  /**
   * Simulate receiving a SysEx message from device
   */
  simulateResponse(data: number[]): void {
    if (this.messageHandler) {
      const message: MidiMessage = {
        timestamp: Date.now(),
        data: [...data],
        type: 'sysex',
      };
      this.messageHandler(message);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Queue a response to be sent after next sendMessage call
   */
  queueResponse(data: number[]): void {
    this.simulatedResponses.push(data);
  }

  /**
   * Get all messages sent through this backend
   */
  getSentMessages(): number[][] {
    return [...this.sentMessages];
  }

  /**
   * Clear sent message history
   */
  clearSentMessages(): void {
    this.sentMessages = [];
  }

  /**
   * Set message handler for simulating incoming messages
   */
  setMessageHandler(handler: (message: MidiMessage) => void): void {
    this.messageHandler = handler;
  }

  // MidiBackendInterface implementation

  async initialize(): Promise<void> {
    this.initialized = true;
  }

  async getInputPorts(): Promise<MidiPortInfo[]> {
    if (!this.initialized) {
      throw new Error('Backend not initialized');
    }
    return [...this.inputPorts];
  }

  async getOutputPorts(): Promise<MidiPortInfo[]> {
    if (!this.initialized) {
      throw new Error('Backend not initialized');
    }
    return [...this.outputPorts];
  }

  async openInput(portId: string): Promise<MidiInputPort> {
    if (!this.initialized) {
      throw new Error('Backend not initialized');
    }

    const portInfo = this.inputPorts.find((p) => p.id === portId);
    if (!portInfo) {
      throw new Error(`Input port not found: ${portId}`);
    }

    const port = new MockMidiInputPort(portId, portInfo.name);
    this.openPorts.set(portId, port);

    // Connect message handler
    port.onMessage = (message: MidiMessage) => {
      if (this.messageHandler) {
        this.messageHandler(message);
      }
    };

    return port;
  }

  async openOutput(portId: string): Promise<MidiOutputPort> {
    if (!this.initialized) {
      throw new Error('Backend not initialized');
    }

    const portInfo = this.outputPorts.find((p) => p.id === portId);
    if (!portInfo) {
      throw new Error(`Output port not found: ${portId}`);
    }

    const port = new MockMidiOutputPort(portId, portInfo.name);
    this.openPorts.set(portId, port);
    return port;
  }

  async sendMessage(port: MidiOutputPort, message: MidiMessage): Promise<void> {
    if (!this.initialized) {
      throw new Error('Backend not initialized');
    }

    // Record sent message
    this.sentMessages.push([...message.data]);

    // Send queued response if available
    if (this.simulatedResponses.length > 0) {
      const response = this.simulatedResponses.shift();
      if (response) {
        // Simulate delay
        setTimeout(() => {
          this.simulateResponse(response);
        }, 10);
      }
    }
  }

  async closePort(port: MidiPort): Promise<void> {
    this.openPorts.delete(port.id);
  }

  async cleanup(): Promise<void> {
    this.openPorts.clear();
    this.sentMessages = [];
    this.simulatedResponses = [];
    this.initialized = false;
  }
}

/**
 * Mock MIDI Input Port
 */
class MockMidiInputPort implements MidiInputPort {
  readonly type = 'input' as const;
  onMessage?: ((message: MidiMessage) => void) | undefined;

  constructor(
    readonly id: string,
    readonly name: string
  ) {}

  async close(): Promise<void> {
    this.onMessage = undefined;
  }
}

/**
 * Mock MIDI Output Port
 */
class MockMidiOutputPort implements MidiOutputPort {
  readonly type = 'output' as const;

  constructor(
    readonly id: string,
    readonly name: string
  ) {}

  async close(): Promise<void> {
    // No-op for mock
  }
}

/**
 * Helper function to create a configured mock backend for Launch Control XL3
 */
export function createMockLCXL3Backend(): MockMidiBackend {
  const backend = new MockMidiBackend();

  backend.configurePorts({
    inputPorts: [
      {
        id: 'lcxl3-in',
        name: 'LCXL3 1 MIDI Out',
        manufacturer: 'Novation',
      },
    ],
    outputPorts: [
      {
        id: 'lcxl3-out',
        name: 'LCXL3 1 MIDI In',
        manufacturer: 'Novation',
      },
    ],
  });

  return backend;
}

/**
 * Helper function to create standard device inquiry response
 */
export function createDeviceInquiryResponse(): number[] {
  return [
    0xf0, // SysEx start
    0x7e, // Universal non-realtime
    0x00, // Device ID
    0x06, // Inquiry response
    0x02, // Sub-ID
    0x00,
    0x20,
    0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
    0x00,
    0x61, // Family code
    0x00,
    0x01, // Family member
    0x01,
    0x00,
    0x00,
    0x00, // Software revision
    0xf7, // SysEx end
  ];
}

/**
 * Helper function to create Novation SYN-ACK response
 */
export function createSynAckResponse(serialNumber = 'TEST1234'): number[] {
  return [
    0xf0, // SysEx start
    0x00,
    0x20,
    0x29, // Manufacturer ID
    0x02, // Device ID
    0x7f, // SYN-ACK command
    ...serialNumber.split('').map((c) => c.charCodeAt(0)),
    0xf7, // SysEx end
  ];
}

/**
 * Helper function to create template change response
 */
export function createTemplateChangeResponse(slot: number): number[] {
  return [
    0xf0, // SysEx start
    0x00,
    0x20,
    0x29, // Manufacturer ID
    0x11, // Device ID
    0x77, // Template change message type
    slot,
    0xf7, // SysEx end
  ];
}
```

```typescript
/**
 * Unit tests for DeviceManager.writeCustomMode() method
 *
 * Tests the Issue #36 fix: slot pre-selection before write operations.
 * Uses dependency injection pattern with mock MIDI backend (NOT module-level mocks).
 */

import { describe, it, expect, beforeEach, vi } from 'vitest';
import { DeviceManager } from '@/device/DeviceManager';
import {
  MockMidiBackend,
  createMockLCXL3Backend,
  createDeviceInquiryResponse,
  createSynAckResponse,
  createTemplateChangeResponse,
} from '../utils/mock-midi-backend';
import { testModes } from '../fixtures/test-modes';

describe('DeviceManager.writeCustomMode', () => {
  let backend: MockMidiBackend;
  let deviceManager: DeviceManager;

  beforeEach(() => {
    // Create fresh mock backend for each test
    backend = createMockLCXL3Backend();

    // Create DeviceManager with injected mock backend
    deviceManager = new DeviceManager({
      midiBackend: backend,
      autoConnect: false,
      inquiryTimeout: 1000,
    });
  });

  describe('Slot Pre-Selection (Issue #36 Fix)', () => {
    it('should call selectTemplate() before write', async () => {
      // Initialize and connect
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      // Queue handshake responses
      backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
      backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());

      await deviceManager.connect();

      // Clear sent messages from connection handshake
      backend.clearSentMessages();

      // Queue responses for slot selection and write
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(5));

      // Perform write to slot 5
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(5, testModes.basic);

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Should have sent:
      // 1. Template selection message (selectTemplate)
      // 2. Custom mode write message
      expect(sentMessages.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(2);

      // First message should be template change (0x77 message type)
      const firstMessage = sentMessages[0];
      expect(firstMessage).toBeDefined();
      expect(firstMessage![0]).toBe(0xf0); // SysEx start
      expect(firstMessage![5]).toBe(0x77); // Template change message type
      expect(firstMessage![6]).toBe(5); // Slot number

      // Second message should be custom mode write (0x15 command, 0x45 write op)
      const secondMessage = sentMessages[1];
      expect(secondMessage).toBeDefined();
      expect(secondMessage![0]).toBe(0xf0); // SysEx start
      expect(secondMessage![4]).toBe(0x15); // Custom mode command
      expect(secondMessage![7]).toBe(0x45); // Write operation
    });

    it('should wait 100ms after slot selection', async () => {
      // Track timing of operations
      const timestamps: number[] = [];

      // Initialize and connect
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
      backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());
      await deviceManager.connect();

      backend.clearSentMessages();

      // Queue slot selection response
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(3));

      // Spy on setTimeout to verify delay
      const setTimeoutSpy = vi.spyOn(global, 'setTimeout');

      // Perform write
      const writePromise = deviceManager.writeCustomMode(3, testModes.minimal);

      // Allow microtasks to process
      await new Promise((resolve) => setTimeout(resolve, 0));

      // Verify setTimeout was called with 100ms delay
      expect(setTimeoutSpy).toHaveBeenCalledWith(expect.any(Function), 100);

      // Wait for write to complete
      await writePromise;

      setTimeoutSpy.mockRestore();
    });

    it('should send correct SysEx message after slot selection', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
      backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());
      await deviceManager.connect();

      backend.clearSentMessages();
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(7));

      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(7, testModes.basic);

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();
      const writeMessage = sentMessages[1]; // Second message is the write

      expect(writeMessage).toBeDefined();

      // Verify SysEx structure
      expect(writeMessage![0]).toBe(0xf0); // Start
      expect(writeMessage![1]).toBe(0x00); // Manufacturer ID byte 1
      expect(writeMessage![2]).toBe(0x20); // Manufacturer ID byte 2
      expect(writeMessage![3]).toBe(0x29); // Manufacturer ID byte 3
      expect(writeMessage![4]).toBe(0x02); // Device ID
      expect(writeMessage![5]).toBe(0x15); // Command (custom mode)
      expect(writeMessage![6]).toBe(0x05); // Sub-command
      expect(writeMessage![7]).toBe(0x00); // Reserved
      expect(writeMessage![8]).toBe(0x45); // Write operation
      expect(writeMessage![writeMessage!.length - 1]).toBe(0xf7); // End
    });
  });

  describe('Slot Validation', () => {
    it('should validate slot range (0-15)', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
      backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());
      await deviceManager.connect();

      // Test lower boundary
      await expect(
        deviceManager.writeCustomMode(-1, testModes.basic)
      ).rejects.toThrow('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');

      // Test upper boundary
      await expect(
        deviceManager.writeCustomMode(16, testModes.basic)
      ).rejects.toThrow('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');

      // Valid slots should not throw
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(0));
      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(0, testModes.basic)).resolves.not.toThrow();

      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(15));
      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(15, testModes.basic)).resolves.not.toThrow();
    });

    it('should handle validation errors before slot selection', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
      backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());
      await deviceManager.connect();

      backend.clearSentMessages();

      // Attempt invalid write
      await expect(
        deviceManager.writeCustomMode(20, testModes.basic)
      ).rejects.toThrow('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');

      // Should NOT have sent any messages (validation failed before)
      expect(backend.getSentMessages().length).toBe(0);
    });
  });

  describe('Error Handling', () => {
    it('should propagate SysEx send errors', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
      backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());
      await deviceManager.connect();

      // Override sendMessage to throw error
      const originalSendMessage = backend.sendMessage.bind(backend);
      backend.sendMessage = async () => {
        throw new Error('MIDI send failed');
      };

      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(5, testModes.basic)).rejects.toThrow(
        'MIDI send failed'
      );

      // Restore
      backend.sendMessage = originalSendMessage;
    });

    it('should throw error when device not connected', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      // Don't connect device
      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(0, testModes.basic)).rejects.toThrow(
        'Device not connected'
      );
    });

    it('should handle slot selection timeout gracefully', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
      backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());
      await deviceManager.connect();

      backend.clearSentMessages();

      // Don't queue slot selection response (will timeout)
      // Note: This test validates that timeout is handled, not that it completes successfully

      const writePromise = deviceManager.writeCustomMode(5, testModes.basic);

      // The write should eventually timeout or handle the missing response
      // Implementation may vary, but it should not hang indefinitely
      await expect(writePromise).resolves.toBeDefined();
    });
  });

  describe('Mode Data Validation', () => {
    it('should accept valid mode data', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
      backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());
      await deviceManager.connect();

      backend.clearSentMessages();
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(0));

      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(0, testModes.basic)).resolves.not.toThrow();
      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(1, testModes.full)).resolves.not.toThrow();
      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(2, testModes.minimal)).resolves.not.toThrow();
    });

    it('should validate mode name is present', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
      backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());
      await deviceManager.connect();

      const invalidMode = {
        name: '',
        controls: {},
        colors: {},
      };

      // Note: Validation logic may vary by implementation
      // This test documents expected behavior
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(0));
      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(0, invalidMode)).resolves.toBeDefined();
    });
  });

  describe('Sequential Write Operations', () => {
    it('should handle multiple writes to same slot', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
      backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());
      await deviceManager.connect();

      backend.clearSentMessages();

      // Write twice to slot 3
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(3));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(3, testModes.basic);

      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(3));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(3, testModes.full);

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Should have 4 messages: 2 slot selections + 2 writes
      expect(sentMessages.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(4);
    });

    it('should handle writes to different slots sequentially', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
      backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());
      await deviceManager.connect();

      backend.clearSentMessages();

      // Write to slots 0, 5, 10
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(0));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(0, testModes.basic);

      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(5));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(5, testModes.full);

      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(10));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(10, testModes.minimal);

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Should have 6 messages: 3 slot selections + 3 writes
      expect(sentMessages.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(6);

      // Verify slot numbers in template change messages
      expect(sentMessages[0]![6]).toBe(0);
      expect(sentMessages[2]![6]).toBe(5);
      expect(sentMessages[4]![6]).toBe(10);
    });
  });
});
```

_**Agent (claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929) (sidechain)**_

Tool use: **Write**

```typescript
/**
 * Integration tests for slot selection during write operations
 *
 * Tests the complete slot selection workflow including:
 * - Writing to inactive slots
 * - Preserving slot order in sequential operations
 * - Handling rapid slot switches
 * - Maintaining slot state correctly
 *
 * Uses dependency injection with mock backend (NOT module-level mocks).
 */

import { describe, it, expect, beforeEach } from 'vitest';
import { DeviceManager } from '@/device/DeviceManager';
import {
  MockMidiBackend,
  createMockLCXL3Backend,
  createDeviceInquiryResponse,
  createSynAckResponse,
  createTemplateChangeResponse,
} from '../utils/mock-midi-backend';
import { testModes } from '../fixtures/test-modes';

describe('Slot Selection Integration', () => {
  let backend: MockMidiBackend;
  let deviceManager: DeviceManager;

  beforeEach(async () => {
    backend = createMockLCXL3Backend();
    deviceManager = new DeviceManager({
      midiBackend: backend,
      autoConnect: false,
      inquiryTimeout: 1000,
    });

    await deviceManager.initialize();

    // Complete handshake
    backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
    backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());
    await deviceManager.connect();

    backend.clearSentMessages();
  });

  describe('Writing to Inactive Slots', () => {
    it('should successfully write to inactive slot', async () => {
      // Assume device is on slot 0, write to slot 5 (inactive)
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(5));

      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(5, testModes.basic)).resolves.not.toThrow();

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Verify slot selection occurred before write
      expect(sentMessages.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(2);

      const slotSelectMessage = sentMessages[0];
      expect(slotSelectMessage![5]).toBe(0x77); // Template change
      expect(slotSelectMessage![6]).toBe(5); // Target slot

      const writeMessage = sentMessages[1];
      expect(writeMessage![5]).toBe(0x15); // Custom mode command
      expect(writeMessage![8]).toBe(0x45); // Write operation
    });

    it('should write to slot 0 from unknown initial slot', async () => {
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(0));

      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(0, testModes.full)).resolves.not.toThrow();

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();
      expect(sentMessages.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(2);

      // First message: select slot 0
      expect(sentMessages[0]![6]).toBe(0);
    });

    it('should write to slot 15 (boundary case)', async () => {
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(15));

      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(15, testModes.minimal)).resolves.not.toThrow();

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      expect(sentMessages.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(2);
      expect(sentMessages[0]![6]).toBe(15); // Slot 15
    });
  });

  describe('Sequential Slot Operations', () => {
    it('should preserve slot order in sequential writes', async () => {
      // Write to slots in order: 1, 2, 3
      const slots = [1, 2, 3];
      const modes = [testModes.basic, testModes.full, testModes.minimal];

      for (let i = 0; i < slots.length; i++) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(slots[i]!));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(slots[i]!, modes[i]!);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Verify each slot was selected in order
      expect(sentMessages[0]![6]).toBe(1);
      expect(sentMessages[2]![6]).toBe(2);
      expect(sentMessages[4]![6]).toBe(3);
    });

    it('should handle non-sequential slot writes', async () => {
      // Write to slots in random order: 7, 2, 15, 0
      const slots = [7, 2, 15, 0];

      for (const slot of slots) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(slot, testModes.basic);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Verify slots were selected in the order requested
      expect(sentMessages[0]![6]).toBe(7);
      expect(sentMessages[2]![6]).toBe(2);
      expect(sentMessages[4]![6]).toBe(15);
      expect(sentMessages[6]![6]).toBe(0);
    });

    it('should handle writing to same slot multiple times', async () => {
      const slot = 4;

      // Write 3 times to same slot
      for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(slot, testModes.basic);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Each write should still perform slot selection
      expect(sentMessages[0]![6]).toBe(slot);
      expect(sentMessages[2]![6]).toBe(slot);
      expect(sentMessages[4]![6]).toBe(slot);
    });
  });

  describe('Rapid Slot Switches', () => {
    it('should handle rapid slot switches without errors', async () => {
      // Rapidly switch between slots 0 and 1
      const operations = [
        { slot: 0, mode: testModes.basic },
        { slot: 1, mode: testModes.full },
        { slot: 0, mode: testModes.minimal },
        { slot: 1, mode: testModes.basic },
      ];

      for (const op of operations) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(op.slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(op.slot, op.mode);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Should have completed all operations
      expect(sentMessages.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(operations.length * 2);

      // Verify slot selections occurred
      expect(sentMessages[0]![6]).toBe(0);
      expect(sentMessages[2]![6]).toBe(1);
      expect(sentMessages[4]![6]).toBe(0);
      expect(sentMessages[6]![6]).toBe(1);
    });

    it('should maintain correct timing between slot selection and write', async () => {
      const timestamps: number[] = [];

      // Track timing by intercepting sendMessage
      const originalSendMessage = backend.sendMessage.bind(backend);
      backend.sendMessage = async (port, message) => {
        timestamps.push(Date.now());
        return originalSendMessage(port, message);
      };

      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(5));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(5, testModes.basic);

      // Should have at least 2 timestamps (select + write)
      expect(timestamps.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(2);

      // Calculate delay between slot selection and write
      if (timestamps.length >= 2) {
        const delay = timestamps[1]! - timestamps[0]!;

        // Delay should be approximately 100ms (allow some variance)
        expect(delay).toBeGreaterThan(50);
        expect(delay).toBeLessThan(200);
      }
    });
  });

  describe('Slot State Maintenance', () => {
    it('should track current slot after selection', async () => {
      // Write to slot 3
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(3));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(3, testModes.basic);

      // Check device status reflects current slot
      const status = deviceManager.getStatus();
      expect(status.currentMode).toBeDefined();
      expect(status.currentMode?.slot).toBe(3);
    });

    it('should update slot state after each write', async () => {
      // Write to multiple slots and verify state updates
      const slots = [1, 5, 10];

      for (const slot of slots) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(slot, testModes.basic);

        const status = deviceManager.getStatus();
        expect(status.currentMode?.slot).toBe(slot);
      }
    });

    it('should emit modeChanged event after slot selection', async () => {
      const modeChanges: number[] = [];

      deviceManager.on('device:modeChanged', (mode) => {
        if (mode.slot !== undefined) {
          modeChanges.push(mode.slot);
        }
      });

      // Write to slot 7
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(7));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(7, testModes.basic);

      // Should have emitted mode change event
      expect(modeChanges).toContain(7);
    });
  });

  describe('Error Recovery', () => {
    it('should handle slot selection failure gracefully', async () => {
      // Don't queue slot selection response (simulate failure)

      // Write should timeout or handle gracefully
      const writePromise = deviceManager.writeCustomMode(5, testModes.basic);

      // Should complete without hanging (may throw or succeed depending on implementation)
      await expect(writePromise).resolves.toBeDefined();
    });

    it('should recover from failed write and allow retry', async () => {
      // First attempt: fail the write
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(3));

      const originalSendMessage = backend.sendMessage.bind(backend);
      let callCount = 0;
      backend.sendMessage = async (port, message) => {
        callCount++;
        if (callCount === 2) {
          // Fail the second message (the write)
          throw new Error('Write failed');
        }
        return originalSendMessage(port, message);
      };

      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(3, testModes.basic)).rejects.toThrow(
        'Write failed'
      );

      // Restore normal behavior
      backend.sendMessage = originalSendMessage;

      // Second attempt: should succeed
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(3));
      await expect(deviceManager.writeCustomMode(3, testModes.basic)).resolves.not.toThrow();
    });
  });
});
```

```typescript
/**
 * Integration tests for cross-slot operations
 *
 * Tests writing to multiple different slots to ensure slot selection
 * mechanism works correctly across all slot boundaries.
 *
 * Uses dependency injection with mock backend (NOT module-level mocks).
 */

import { describe, it, expect, beforeEach } from 'vitest';
import { DeviceManager } from '@/device/DeviceManager';
import {
  MockMidiBackend,
  createMockLCXL3Backend,
  createDeviceInquiryResponse,
  createSynAckResponse,
  createTemplateChangeResponse,
} from '../utils/mock-midi-backend';
import { testModes } from '../fixtures/test-modes';

describe('Cross-Slot Operations', () => {
  let backend: MockMidiBackend;
  let deviceManager: DeviceManager;

  beforeEach(async () => {
    backend = createMockLCXL3Backend();
    deviceManager = new DeviceManager({
      midiBackend: backend,
      autoConnect: false,
      inquiryTimeout: 1000,
    });

    await deviceManager.initialize();

    backend.queueResponse(createSynAckResponse('TEST1234'));
    backend.queueResponse(createDeviceInquiryResponse());
    await deviceManager.connect();

    backend.clearSentMessages();
  });

  describe('Multiple Slot Writes', () => {
    it('should write to multiple slots sequentially', async () => {
      const operations = [
        { slot: 0, mode: testModes.basic },
        { slot: 1, mode: testModes.full },
        { slot: 2, mode: testModes.minimal },
        { slot: 3, mode: testModes.boundary },
      ];

      for (const op of operations) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(op.slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(op.slot, op.mode);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Should have 8 messages: 4 slot selections + 4 writes
      expect(sentMessages.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(8);

      // Verify each slot was selected correctly
      expect(sentMessages[0]![6]).toBe(0);
      expect(sentMessages[2]![6]).toBe(1);
      expect(sentMessages[4]![6]).toBe(2);
      expect(sentMessages[6]![6]).toBe(3);

      // Verify write operations followed each selection
      expect(sentMessages[1]![8]).toBe(0x45); // Write op
      expect(sentMessages[3]![8]).toBe(0x45);
      expect(sentMessages[5]![8]).toBe(0x45);
      expect(sentMessages[7]![8]).toBe(0x45);
    });

    it('should write to all 16 slots successfully', async () => {
      for (let slot = 0; slot < 16; slot++) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(slot, testModes.basic);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Should have 32 messages: 16 selections + 16 writes
      expect(sentMessages.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(32);

      // Verify all slots were selected
      for (let i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
        const slotSelectIndex = i * 2;
        expect(sentMessages[slotSelectIndex]![6]).toBe(i);
      }
    });

    it('should handle sparse slot writes', async () => {
      // Write only to slots 0, 5, 10, 15
      const slots = [0, 5, 10, 15];

      for (const slot of slots) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(slot, testModes.minimal);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      expect(sentMessages.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(8);

      // Verify only the specified slots were selected
      expect(sentMessages[0]![6]).toBe(0);
      expect(sentMessages[2]![6]).toBe(5);
      expect(sentMessages[4]![6]).toBe(10);
      expect(sentMessages[6]![6]).toBe(15);
    });
  });

  describe('Boundary Slot Transitions', () => {
    it('should handle slot 0 ‚Üí slot 15 write', async () => {
      // Write to slot 0
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(0));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(0, testModes.basic);

      // Then write to slot 15
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(15));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(15, testModes.full);

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Verify transition from lowest to highest slot
      expect(sentMessages[0]![6]).toBe(0);
      expect(sentMessages[2]![6]).toBe(15);

      // Both writes should succeed
      expect(sentMessages[1]![8]).toBe(0x45);
      expect(sentMessages[3]![8]).toBe(0x45);
    });

    it('should handle slot 15 ‚Üí slot 0 write', async () => {
      // Write to slot 15
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(15));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(15, testModes.full);

      // Then write to slot 0
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(0));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(0, testModes.basic);

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Verify transition from highest to lowest slot
      expect(sentMessages[0]![6]).toBe(15);
      expect(sentMessages[2]![6]).toBe(0);

      expect(sentMessages[1]![8]).toBe(0x45);
      expect(sentMessages[3]![8]).toBe(0x45);
    });

    it('should handle middle slot boundary transitions', async () => {
      // Test transitions around middle slots (7 ‚Üí 8)
      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(7));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(7, testModes.basic);

      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(8));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(8, testModes.full);

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      expect(sentMessages[0]![6]).toBe(7);
      expect(sentMessages[2]![6]).toBe(8);
    });
  });

  describe('Slot Data Verification', () => {
    it('should verify each slot receives correct data', async () => {
      const testData = [
        { slot: 0, mode: testModes.basic, expectedName: 'Test1' },
        { slot: 5, mode: testModes.full, expectedName: 'FullMode' },
        { slot: 10, mode: testModes.minimal, expectedName: 'Min' },
      ];

      for (const test of testData) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(test.slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(test.slot, test.mode);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Verify each write message contains the correct mode name
      // Mode names are encoded in the write message payload
      for (let i = 0; i < testData.length; i++) {
        const writeMessageIndex = i * 2 + 1; // Every second message is a write
        const writeMessage = sentMessages[writeMessageIndex];

        // Convert message bytes to string to check for mode name
        const messageStr = String.fromCharCode(...writeMessage!.slice(10, -1));

        expect(messageStr).toContain(testData[i]!.expectedName);
      }
    });

    it('should maintain separate data for each slot', async () => {
      // Write different modes to different slots
      const slot1Mode = testModes.basic; // "Test1"
      const slot2Mode = testModes.full; // "FullMode"

      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(1));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(1, slot1Mode);

      backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(2));
      await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(2, slot2Mode);

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Verify slot 1 write contains "Test1"
      const slot1Write = sentMessages[1];
      const slot1Str = String.fromCharCode(...slot1Write!.slice(10, -1));
      expect(slot1Str).toContain('Test1');

      // Verify slot 2 write contains "FullMode"
      const slot2Write = sentMessages[3];
      const slot2Str = String.fromCharCode(...slot2Write!.slice(10, -1));
      expect(slot2Str).toContain('FullMode');
    });

    it('should preserve slot independence in rapid writes', async () => {
      // Rapidly write different data to adjacent slots
      const operations = [
        { slot: 0, mode: testModes.basic },
        { slot: 1, mode: testModes.full },
        { slot: 0, mode: testModes.minimal }, // Overwrite slot 0
      ];

      for (const op of operations) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(op.slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(op.slot, op.mode);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Verify slot 0 first write
      const slot0FirstWrite = sentMessages[1];
      expect(String.fromCharCode(...slot0FirstWrite!.slice(10, -1))).toContain('Test1');

      // Verify slot 1 write (should not be affected by slot 0 operations)
      const slot1Write = sentMessages[3];
      expect(String.fromCharCode(...slot1Write!.slice(10, -1))).toContain('FullMode');

      // Verify slot 0 second write (overwrites first)
      const slot0SecondWrite = sentMessages[5];
      expect(String.fromCharCode(...slot0SecondWrite!.slice(10, -1))).toContain('Min');
    });
  });

  describe('Slot Write Patterns', () => {
    it('should handle forward sequential pattern (0‚Üí15)', async () => {
      for (let slot = 0; slot < 16; slot++) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(slot, testModes.basic);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Verify sequential order
      for (let i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
        expect(sentMessages[i * 2]![6]).toBe(i);
      }
    });

    it('should handle reverse sequential pattern (15‚Üí0)', async () => {
      for (let slot = 15; slot >= 0; slot--) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(slot, testModes.basic);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Verify reverse order
      for (let i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
        expect(sentMessages[i * 2]![6]).toBe(15 - i);
      }
    });

    it('should handle alternating pattern (0,15,1,14,2,13...)', async () => {
      const pattern = [];
      for (let i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
        pattern.push(i);
        pattern.push(15 - i);
      }

      for (const slot of pattern) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(slot, testModes.basic);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Verify alternating pattern
      for (let i = 0; i < pattern.length; i++) {
        expect(sentMessages[i * 2]![6]).toBe(pattern[i]);
      }
    });

    it('should handle random access pattern', async () => {
      const randomSlots = [3, 11, 7, 1, 14, 5, 9, 0, 15, 6];

      for (const slot of randomSlots) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(slot, testModes.basic);
      }

      const sentMessages = backend.getSentMessages();

      // Verify each slot was accessed in the random order
      for (let i = 0; i < randomSlots.length; i++) {
        expect(sentMessages[i * 2]![6]).toBe(randomSlots[i]);
      }
    });
  });

  describe('Performance Characteristics', () => {
    it('should complete multi-slot writes within reasonable time', async () => {
      const startTime = Date.now();

      // Write to 8 different slots
      for (let slot = 0; slot < 8; slot++) {
        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(slot, testModes.basic);
      }

      const duration = Date.now() - startTime;

      // Each write has ~100ms delay + processing time
      // 8 writes should complete in < 2 seconds (conservative)
      expect(duration).toBeLessThan(2000);
    });

    it('should maintain consistent timing across slots', async () => {
      const durations: number[] = [];

      for (let slot = 0; slot < 5; slot++) {
        const start = Date.now();

        backend.queueResponse(createTemplateChangeResponse(slot));
        await deviceManager.writeCustomMode(slot, testModes.basic);

        durations.push(Date.now() - start);
      }

      // All write operations should take similar time
      const avgDuration = durations.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / durations.length;
      const maxDeviation = Math.max(...durations.map((d) => Math.abs(d - avgDuration)));

      // Allow max 50% deviation from average
      expect(maxDeviation).toBeLessThan(avgDuration * 0.5);
    });
  });
});
```
